◆ add_mon_group() [2/2]

void overmap::add_mon_group ( const mongroup &  group,
int  radius 
)
private

Definition at line 7248 of file overmap.cpp.

7249 {
7250  // We only spread the groups out when radius is greater than 1
7251  if( radius <= 1 ) {
7252  add_mon_group( group );
7253  return;
7254  }
7255  const int rad = std::max<int>( 0, radius );
7256  const double total_area = rad * rad * M_PI + 1;
7257  const double pop = std::max<int>( 0, group.population );
7258  for( int x = -rad; x <= rad; x++ ) {
7259  for( int y = -rad; y <= rad; y++ ) {
7260  const int dist = trig_dist( point( x, y ), point_zero );
7261  if( dist > rad ) {
7262  continue;
7263  }
7264  // Population on a single submap, *not* a integer
7265  double pop_here;
7266  if( rad == 0 ) {
7267  pop_here = pop;
7268  } else {
7269  // This computation is delicate, be careful and see
7270  // https://github.com/CleverRaven/Cataclysm-DDA/issues/26941
7271  pop_here = ( static_cast<double>( rad - dist ) / rad ) * pop / total_area;
7272  }
7273  if( pop_here > pop || pop_here < 0 ) {
7274  DebugLog( D_ERROR, D_GAME ) << group.type.str() << ": invalid population here: " << pop_here;
7275  }
7276  int p = std::max( 0, static_cast<int>( std::floor( pop_here ) ) );
7277  if( pop_here - p != 0 ) {
7278  // in case the population is something like 0.2, randomly add a
7279  // single population unit, this *should* on average give the correct
7280  // total population.
7281  const int mod = static_cast<int>( 10000.0 * ( pop_here - p ) );
7282  if( x_in_y( mod, 10000 ) ) {
7283  p++;
7284  }
7285  }
7286  if( p == 0 ) {
7287  continue;
7288  }
7289  // Exact copy to keep all important values, only change what's needed
7290  // for a single-submap group.
7291  mongroup tmp( group );
7292  tmp.abs_pos += point( x, y );
7293  tmp.population = p;
7294  // This *can* create groups outside of the area of this overmap.
7295  // As this function is called during generating the overmap, the
7296  // neighboring overmaps might not have been generated and one can't access
7297  // them through the overmapbuffer as this would trigger generating them.
7298  // This would in turn to lead to a call to this function again.
7299  // To avoid this, the overmapbuffer checks the monster groups when loading
7300  // an overmap and moves groups with out-of-bounds position to another overmap.
7301  add_mon_group( tmp );
7302  }
7303  }
7304 }
x_in_y
bool x_in_y(const time_duration &a, const time_duration &b)
Definition: calendar.cpp:784
cata_variant_type::point

5624

5626  return; // Don't bother.
5627  }
5628  // Build the actual street.
5629  build_connection( connection, street_path, 0 );
5630  // Grow in the stated direction, sprouting off sub-roads and placing buildings as we go.
5631  const auto from = std::next( street_path.nodes.begin() );
5632  const auto to = street_path.nodes.end();
5633 
5634  //Alternate wide and thin blocks
5635  int new_width = block_width == 2 ? rng( 3, 5 ) : 2;
5636 
5637  for( auto iter = from; iter != to; ++iter ) {
5638  --c;
5639 
5640  const tripoint_om_omt rp( iter->pos, 0 );
5641  if( c >= 2 && c < croad - block_width ) {
5642  croad = c;
5643  int left = cs - rng( 1, 3 );
5644  int right = cs - rng( 1, 3 );
5645 
5646  //Remove 1 length road nubs
5647  if( left == 1 ) {
5648  left++;
5649  }
5650  if( right == 1 ) {
5651  right++;
5652  }
5653 
5654  build_city_street( connection, iter->pos, left, om_direction::turn_left( dir ),
5655  town, new_width );
5656 
5657  build_city_street( connection, iter->pos, right, om_direction::turn_right( dir ),
5658  town, new_width );

5662  if( one_in( 2 ) && oter->get_line() == 15 && oter->type_is( oter_type_id( "road" ) ) ) {
5663  ter_set( rp, oter_road_nesw_manhole.id() );
5664  }
5665  }
5666 
5667  if( !one_in( BUILDINGCHANCE ) ) {
5668  place_building( rp, om_direction::turn_left( dir ), town );
5669  }
5670  if( !one_in( BUILDINGCHANCE ) ) {
5671  place_building( rp, om_direction::turn_right( dir ), town );
5672  }
5673  }
5674 
5675  // If we're big, make a right turn at the edge of town.
5676  // Seems to make little neighborhoods.
5677  cs -= rng( 1, 3 );
5678 
5679  if( cs >= 2 && c == 0 ) {
5680  const auto &last_node = street_path.nodes.back();
5681  const om_direction::type rnd_dir = om_direction::turn_random( dir );
5682  build_city_street( connection, last_node.pos, cs, rnd_dir, town );
5683  if( one_in( 5 ) ) {
5684  build_city_street( connection, last_node.pos, cs, om_direction::opposite( rnd_dir ),
5685  town, new_width );
5686  }

6102  const tripoint_om_omt pos( node.pos, z );
6103  const oter_id &ter_id = ter( pos );
6104  const om_direction::type new_dir = node.dir;
6105  const overmap_connection::subtype *subtype = connection.pick_subtype_for( ter_id );
6106 
6107  if( !subtype ) {
6108  debugmsg( "No suitable subtype of connection \"%s\" found for \"%s\".", connection.id.c_str(),
6109  ter_id.id().c_str() );
6110  return;

6115 
6116  if( new_dir != om_direction::type::invalid ) {
6117  new_line = om_lines::set_segment( new_line, new_dir );
6118  }
6119 
6120  if( prev_dir != om_direction::type::invalid ) {
6121  new_line = om_lines::set_segment( new_line, om_direction::opposite( prev_dir ) );
6122  }
6123 
6124  for( const om_direction::type dir : om_direction::all ) {
6125  const tripoint_om_omt np( pos + om_direction::displace( dir ) );
6126 
6127  if( inbounds( np ) ) {
6128  const oter_id &near_id = ter( np );
6129 
6130  if( connection.has( near_id ) ) {
6131  if( near_id->is_linear() ) {
6132  const size_t near_line = near_id->get_line();
6133

6135  // Mutual connection.
6136  const size_t new_near_line = om_lines::set_segment( near_line, om_direction::opposite( dir ) );
6137  ter_set( np, near_id->get_type_id()->get_linear( new_near_line ) );
6138  new_line = om_lines::set_segment( new_line, dir );
6139  }
6140  } else if( near_id->is_rotatable() && om_direction::are_parallel( dir, near_id->get_dir() ) ) {
6141  new_line = om_lines::set_segment( new_line, dir );
6142  }
6143  }
6144  } else if( pos.xy() == start.pos || pos.xy() == end.pos ) {
6145  // Only automatically connect to out of bounds locations if we're the start or end of this path.
6146  new_line = om_lines::set_segment( new_line, dir );
6147 
6148  // Add this connection point to our connections out.
6149  std::vector<tripoint_om_omt> &outs = connections_out[connection.id];
6150  const auto existing_out = std::find_if( outs.begin(),
6151  outs.end(), [pos]( const tripoint_om_omt & c ) {
6152  return c == pos;
6153  } );
6154  if( existing_out == outs.end() ) {
6155  outs.emplace_back( pos );
6156  }
6157  }
6158  }
6159 
6160  if( new_line == om_lines::invalid ) {
6161  debugmsg( "Invalid path for connection \"%s\".", connection.id.c_str() );
6162  return;
6163  }
6164 
6165  ter_set( pos, subtype->terrain->get_linear( new_line ) );
6166  } else if( new_dir != om_direction::type::invalid ) {
6167  ter_set( pos, subtype->terrain->get_rotated( new_dir ) );
6168  }

◆ build_lab()

bool overmap::build_lab ( const tripoint_om_omt &  p,
int  s,
std::vector< point_om_omt > *  lab_train_points,
const std::string &  prefix,
int  train_odds 
)
private

Definition at line 5690 of file overmap.cpp.

5693 {
5694  std::vector<tripoint_om_omt> generated_lab;
5695  const oter_id labt( prefix + "lab" );
5696  const oter_id labt_stairs( labt.id().str() + "_stairs" );
5697  const oter_id labt_core( labt.id().str() + "_core" );
5698  const oter_id labt_finale( labt.id().str() + "_finale" );
5699  const oter_id labt_ants( "ants_lab" );
5700  const oter_id labt_ants_stairs( "ants_lab_stairs" );
5701 
5702  ter_set( p, labt );
5703  generated_lab.push_back( p );
5704 
5705  // maintain a list of potential new lab maps
5706  // grows outwards from previously placed lab maps
5707  std::set<tripoint_om_omt> candidates;
5708  candidates.insert( { p + point_north, p + point_east, p + point_south, p + point_west } );
5709  while( !candidates.empty() ) {
5710  const tripoint_om_omt cand = *candidates.begin();
5711  candidates.erase( candidates.begin() );
5712  if( !inbounds( cand ) ) {
5713  continue;
5714  }
5715  const int dist = manhattan_dist( p.xy(), cand.xy() );
5716  if( dist <= s * 2 ) { // increase radius to compensate for sparser new algorithm
5717  int dist_increment = s > 3 ? 3 : 2; // Determines at what distance the odds of placement decreases
5718  if( one_in( dist / dist_increment + 1 ) ) { // odds diminish farther away from the stairs
5719  // make an ants lab if it's a basic lab and ants were there before.
5720  if( prefix.empty() && check_ot( "ants", ot_match_type::type, cand ) ) {
5721  // skip over a queen's chamber.
5722  if( ter( cand )->get_type_id() != oter_type_ants_queen ) {
5723  ter_set( cand, labt_ants );
5724  }
5725  } else {
5726  ter_set( cand, labt );
5727  }
5728  generated_lab.push_back( cand );
5729  // add new candidates, don't backtrack
5730  for( const point &offset : four_adjacent_offsets ) {
5731  const tripoint_om_omt new_cand = cand + offset;
5732  const int new_dist = manhattan_dist( p.xy(), new_cand.xy() );
5733  if( ter( new_cand ) != labt && new_dist > dist ) {
5734  candidates.insert( new_cand );
5735  }
5736  }
5737  }
5738  }
5739  }
5740 
5741  bool generate_stairs = true;
5742  for( tripoint_om_omt &elem : generated_lab ) {
5743  // Use a check for "_stairs" to catch the hidden_lab_stairs tiles.
5744  if( is_ot_match( "_stairs", ter( elem + tripoint_above ), ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
5745  generate_stairs = false;
5746  }
5747  }
5748  if( generate_stairs && !generated_lab.empty() ) {
5749  std::shuffle( generated_lab.begin(), generated_lab.end(), rng_get_engine() );
5750 
5751  // we want a spot where labs are above, but we'll settle for the last element if necessary.
5752  tripoint_om_omt lab_pos;
5753  for( tripoint_om_omt elem : generated_lab ) {
5754  lab_pos = elem;
5755  if( ter( lab_pos + tripoint_above ) == labt ) {
5756  break;
5757  }
5758  }
5759  ter_set( lab_pos + tripoint_above, labt_stairs );
5760  }
5761 
5762  ter_set( p, labt_core );
5763  int numstairs = 0;
5764  if( s > 0 ) { // Build stairs going down
5765  while( !one_in( 6 ) ) {
5766  tripoint_om_omt stair;
5767  int tries = 0;
5768  do {
5769  stair = p + point( rng( -s, s ), rng( -s, s ) );
5770  tries++;
5771  } while( ( ter( stair ) != labt && ter( stair ) != labt_ants ) && tries < 15 );
5772  if( tries < 15 ) {
5773  if( ter( stair ) == labt_ants ) {
5774  ter_set( stair, labt_ants_stairs );
5775  } else {
5776  ter_set( stair, labt_stairs );
5777  }
5778  numstairs++;
5779  }
5780  }
5781  }
5782 
5783  // We need a finale on the bottom of labs. Central labs have a chance of additional finales.
5784  if( numstairs == 0 || ( prefix == "central_" && one_in( -p.z() - 1 ) ) ) {
5785  tripoint_om_omt finale;
5786  int tries = 0;
5787  do {
5788  finale = p + point( rng( -s, s ), rng( -s, s ) );
5789  tries++;
5790  } while( tries < 15 && ter( finale ) != labt && ter( finale ) != labt_core );
5791  ter_set( finale, labt_finale );
5792  }
5793 
5794  if( train_odds > 0 && one_in( train_odds ) ) {
5795  tripoint_om_omt train;
5796  int tries = 0;
5797  int adjacent_labs;
5798 
5799  do {
5800  train = p + point( rng( -s * 1.5 - 1, s * 1.5 + 1 ), rng( -s * 1.5 - 1, s * 1.5 + 1 ) );
5801  tries++;
5802 
5803  adjacent_labs = 0;
5804  for( const point &offset : four_adjacent_offsets ) {
5805  if( is_ot_match( "lab", ter( train + offset ), ot_match_type::contains ) &&
5806  !is_ot_match( "lab_subway", ter( train + offset ), ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
5807  ++adjacent_labs;
5808  }
5809  }
5810  } while( tries < 50 && (
5811  ter( train ) == labt ||
5812  ter( train ) == labt_stairs ||
5813  ter( train ) == labt_finale ||
5814  adjacent_labs != 1 ) );
5815  if( tries < 50 ) {
5816  lab_train_points->push_back( train.xy() ); // possible train depot
5817  // next is rail connection
5818  for( const point &offset : four_adjacent_offsets ) {
5819  if( is_ot_match( "lab", ter( train + offset ), ot_match_type::contains ) &&
5820  !is_ot_match( "lab_subway", ter( train + offset ), ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
5821  lab_train_points->push_back( train.xy() - offset );
5822  break;
5823  }
5824  }
5825  }
5826  }
5827 
5828  // 4th story of labs is a candidate for lab escape, as long as there's no train or finale.
5829  if( prefix.empty() && p.z() == -4 && train_odds == 0 && numstairs > 0 ) {
5830  tripoint_om_omt cell;
5831  int tries = 0;
5832  int adjacent_labs = 0;
5833 
5834  // Find a space bordering just one lab to the south.
5835  do {
5836  cell = p + point( rng( -s * 1.5 - 1, s * 1.5 + 1 ), rng( -s * 1.5 - 1, s * 1.5 + 1 ) );
5837  tries++;
5838 
5839  adjacent_labs = 0;
5840  for( const point &offset : four_adjacent_offsets ) {
5841  if( is_ot_match( "lab", ter( cell + offset ), ot_match_type::contains ) &&
5842  !is_ot_match( "lab_subway", ter( cell + offset ), ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
5843  ++adjacent_labs;
5844  }
5845  }
5846  } while( tries < 50 && (
5847  ter( cell ) == labt_stairs ||
5848  ter( cell ) == labt_finale ||
5849  ter( cell + point_south ) != labt ||
5850  adjacent_labs != 1 ) );
5851  if( tries < 50 ) {
5852  ter_set( cell, oter_lab_escape_cells.id() );
5853  ter_set( cell + point_south, oter_lab_escape_entrance.id() );
5854  }
5855  }
5856 
5857  return numstairs > 0;
5858 }

5864 
5865  bool requires_sub = false;
5866  for( auto p : points_in_radius( origin, s + origin.z() + 1, 0 ) ) {
5867  int dist = square_dist( origin.xy(), p.xy() );
5868  if( one_in( 2 * dist ) ) {
5869  chip_rock( p );
5870  if( one_in( 8 ) && origin.z() > -OVERMAP_DEPTH ) {

5872  requires_sub = true;

5350  forest_size_adjust -= this_om.x() * western_forest_increase;
5351  }

5353  forest_size_adjust -= this_om.y() * northern_forest_increase;

5356  forest_size_adjust += this_om.x() * eastern_forest_increase;

5359  forest_size_adjust += this_om.y() * southern_forest_increase;
5360  }

5363  // make sure forest size never totally overwhelms the map

4737  ocean_adjust_N = 0.0005f * static_cast<float>( OMAPY - p.y()
4738  + std::abs( ( this_om.y() + northern_ocean ) * OMAPY ) );
4739  }

4742  * OMAPX );
4743  }

4746  + std::abs( ( this_om.x() + western_ocean ) * OMAPX ) );
4747  }
4748  if( southern_ocean > 0 && this_om.y() >= southern_ocean ) {
4749  ocean_adjust_S = 0.0005f * static_cast<float>( p.y() + ( this_om.y() - southern_ocean ) * OMAPY );
4750  }

5387  urbanity_adj -= this_om.y() * northern_urban_increase / 10.0f;

5389  // Doesn't apply if we expect megacity in those directions as well.

5391  urbanity_adj /= std::max( this_om.x() / -2.0f, 1.0f );
5392  }

5407  urbanity_adj -= this_om.x() * western_urban_increase / 10.0f;

5409  urbanity_adj /= std::max( this_om.y() / -2.0f, 1.0f );

◆ connect_closest_points()

void overmap::connect_closest_points ( const std::vector< point_om_omt > &  points,
int  z,
const overmap_connection &  connection 
)

Definition at line 6186 of file overmap.cpp.

6188 {
6189  // { weight, {i, j} }
6190  using edge = std::pair<float, std::pair<size_t, size_t>>;
6191 
6192  if( points.size() < 2 ) {
6193  return;
6194  }
6195 
6196  std::vector<edge> edges;
6197 
6198  // enumerate every possible connection between the points
6199  edges.reserve( points.size() * ( points.size() - 1 ) / 2 );
6200  for( size_t i = 0; i < points.size() - 1; ++i ) {
6201  for( size_t j = i + 1; j < points.size(); j++ ) {
6202  const float distance = trig_dist( points[i], points[j] );
6203  edges.push_back( {distance, {i, j}} );
6204  }
6205  }
6206 
6207  // sort from shortest to longest
6208  sort( edges.begin(), edges.end() );
6209 
6210  // track which subgraph each point belongs to
6211  std::vector<int> subgraphs( points.size(), -1 );
6212 
6213  for( edge candidate : edges ) {
6214  const size_t i = candidate.second.first;
6215  const size_t j = candidate.second.second;
6216  bool connect = false;
6217  if( subgraphs[i] < 0 && subgraphs[j] < 0 ) {
6218  // neither point of this connection has been connected yet
6219  // identify them each as the root of a new subgraph
6220  subgraphs[i] = i;
6221  subgraphs[j] = j;
6222  // and connect them
6223  connect = true;
6224  } else if( subgraphs[i] < 0 ) {
6225  // j is already connected to something
6226  // add i to j's subgraph
6227  subgraphs[i] = subgraphs[j];
6228  // and connect them
6229  connect = true;
6230  } else if( subgraphs[j] < 0 ) {
6231  // i is already connected to something
6232  // add j to i's subgraph
6233  subgraphs[j] = subgraphs[i];
6234  // and connect them
6235  connect = true;
6236  } else if( subgraphs[i] != subgraphs[j] ) {
6237  // i and j are both connected to different subgraphs
6238  // join the subgraphs
6239  int dead_subtree = subgraphs[j];
6240  for( size_t k = 0; k < points.size(); k++ ) {
6241  if( subgraphs[k] == dead_subtree ) {
6242  subgraphs[k] = subgraphs[i];
6243  }
6244  }
6245  // and connect them
6246  connect = true;
6247  } else if( one_in( 10 ) ) {
6248  // the remaining case is that i and j are already in the same subgraph
6249  // making this connection creates a loop
6250  connect = true;
6251  }
6252 
6253  if( connect ) {
6254  build_connection( points[i], points[j], z, connection, false );
6255  }
6256  }
6257 }
edge

3456  int z = -1;
3457  bool requires_sub = false;

3460  } while( requires_sub && ( --z >= -OVERMAP_DEPTH ) );

3463  z = 1;
3464  bool requires_over = false;
3465  do {
3466  requires_over = generate_over( z );
3467  } while( requires_over && ( ++z <= OVERMAP_HEIGHT ) );
3468

3470  place_mongroups();
3471  place_radios();

3820 {
3821  std::vector<std::pair<point_om_omt, std::string>> bridgehead_points;
3822  for( const point_om_omt &bp : bridge_points ) {
3823  //const oter_id oter_ground = ter( tripoint_om_omt( bp, 0 ) );
3824  const oter_id oter_ground_north = ter( tripoint_om_omt( bp, 0 ) + tripoint_north );
3825  const oter_id oter_ground_south = ter( tripoint_om_omt( bp, 0 ) + tripoint_south );
3826  const oter_id oter_ground_east = ter( tripoint_om_omt( bp, 0 ) + tripoint_east );
3827  const oter_id oter_ground_west = ter( tripoint_om_omt( bp, 0 ) + tripoint_west );
3828  const bool is_bridge_north = ( oter_ground_north->get_type_id() == bridge_type )
3829  && ( oter_get_rotation( oter_ground_north ) % 2 == 0 );
3830  const bool is_bridge_south = ( oter_ground_south->get_type_id() == bridge_type )
3831  && ( oter_get_rotation( oter_ground_south ) % 2 == 0 );
3832  const bool is_bridge_east = ( oter_ground_east->get_type_id() == bridge_type )
3833  && ( oter_get_rotation( oter_ground_east ) % 2 == 1 );
3834  const bool is_bridge_west = ( oter_ground_west->get_type_id() == bridge_type )
3835  && ( oter_get_rotation( oter_ground_west ) % 2 == 1 );
3836 
3837  if( is_bridge_north ^ is_bridge_south || is_bridge_east ^ is_bridge_west ) {
3838  std::string ramp_facing;
3839  if( is_bridge_north ) {
3840  ramp_facing = "_south";
3841  } else if( is_bridge_south ) {
3842  ramp_facing = "_north";
3843  } else if( is_bridge_east ) {
3844  ramp_facing = "_west";
3845  } else {
3846  ramp_facing = "_east";
3847  }
3848  bridgehead_points.emplace_back( bp, ramp_facing );
3849  }
3850  }
3851  for( const std::pair<point_om_omt, std::string> &bhp : bridgehead_points ) {
3852  tripoint_om_omt p( bhp.first, 0 );
3853  ter_set( p, oter_id( bridgehead_ground + bhp.second ) );
3854  ter_set( p + tripoint_above, oter_id( bridgehead_ramp + bhp.second ) );
3855  }
3856 }

3777  if( z == 1 ) {
3778  for( int i = 0; i < OMAPX; i++ ) {
3779  for( int j = 0; j < OMAPY; j++ ) {
3780  tripoint_om_omt p( i, j, z );
3781  const oter_id oter_below = ter( p + tripoint_below );
3782  const oter_id oter_ground = ter( tripoint_om_omt( p.xy(), 0 ) );
3783 
3784  // implicitly skip skip_below oter_ids
3785  if( skip_below.find( oter_below ) != skip_below.end() ) {
3786  continue;
3787  }
3788 
3789  if( oter_ground->get_type_id() == oter_type_bridge ) {
3790  ter_set( p, oter_id( "bridge_road" + oter_get_rotation_string( oter_ground ) ) );
3791  bridge_points.push_back( p.xy() );
3792  tripoint_om_omt support_point = p + tripoint_below;
3793  int support_z = 0;
3794  // place the rest of the support columns
3795  while( ter( support_point ) -> is_water() && --support_z >= -OVERMAP_DEPTH ) {
3796  ter_set( support_point, oter_id( "bridge" + oter_get_rotation_string( oter_ground ) ) );
3797  support_point += tripoint_below;
3798  }
3799  }
3800  if( oter_ground->get_type_id() == oter_type_railroad_bridge ) {
3801  ter_set( p, oter_id( "railroad_bridge_overpass" + oter_get_rotation_string( oter_ground ) ) );
3802  railroad_bridge_points.push_back( p.xy() );
3803  }
3804  }
3805  }
3806  }
3807 
3808  generate_bridgeheads( bridge_points, oter_type_bridge,
3809  "bridgehead_ground", "bridgehead_ramp" );
3810  generate_bridgeheads( railroad_bridge_points, oter_type_railroad_bridge,
3811  "railroad_bridgehead_ground", "railroad_bridgehead_ramp" );
3812 
3813  return requires_over;
3814 }

3593  continue;

3606  above_action_it->second( p );

3620  // A third of overmaps have labs with a 1-in-2 chance of being subway connected.
3621  // If the central lab exists, all labs which go down to z=4 will have a subway to central.
3622  int lab_train_odds = 0;
3623  if( z == -2 && one_in( 3 ) ) {
3624  lab_train_odds = 2;
3625  }
3626  if( z == -4 && !central_lab_points.empty() ) {
3627  lab_train_odds = 1;
3628  }
3629

3633  if( !lab && ter( tripoint_om_omt( i.pos, z ) ) == oter_lab_core ) {
3634  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( i.pos, z ), oter_lab.id() );
3635  }
3636  }

3653 
3654  const auto create_real_train_lab_points = [this, z](
3655  const std::vector<point_om_omt> &train_points,
3656  std::vector<point_om_omt> &real_train_points ) {
3657  bool is_first_in_pair = true;
3658  for( const point_om_omt &p : train_points ) {
3659  tripoint_om_omt i( p, z );
3660  const std::vector<tripoint_om_omt> nearby_locations {
3661  i + point_north,
3662  i + point_south,
3663  i + point_east,
3664  i + point_west };
3665  if( is_first_in_pair ) {
3666  ter_set( i, oter_open_air.id() ); // mark tile to prevent subway gen
3667 
3668  for( const tripoint_om_omt &nearby_loc : nearby_locations ) {
3669  if( is_ot_match( "empty_rock", ter( nearby_loc ), ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
3670  // mark tile to prevent subway gen
3671  ter_set( nearby_loc, oter_open_air.id() );
3672  }
3673  if( is_ot_match( "solid_earth", ter( nearby_loc ), ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
3674  // mark tile to prevent subway gen
3675  ter_set( nearby_loc, oter_field.id() );
3676  }
3677  }
3678  } else {
3679  // change train connection point back to rock to allow gen
3680  if( is_ot_match( "open_air", ter( i ), ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
3681  ter_set( i, oter_empty_rock.id() );
3682  }
3683  if( is_ot_match( "field", ter( i ), ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
3684  ter_set( i, oter_solid_earth.id() );
3685  }
3686  real_train_points.push_back( i.xy() );
3687  }
3688  is_first_in_pair = !is_first_in_pair;
3689  }
3690  };
3691  std::vector<point_om_omt>
3692  subway_lab_train_points; // real points for subway, excluding train depot points
3693  create_real_train_lab_points( lab_train_points, subway_lab_train_points );
3694  create_real_train_lab_points( central_lab_train_points, subway_lab_train_points );
3695 
3696  subway_points.insert( subway_points.end(), subway_lab_train_points.begin(),
3697  subway_lab_train_points.end() );
3698  const overmap_connection_id &overmap_connection_subway_tunnel =
3699  settings->overmap_connection.subway_connection;
3700  connect_closest_points( subway_points, z, *overmap_connection_subway_tunnel );
3701 
3702  for( auto &i : subway_points ) {
3703  if( ( ter( tripoint_om_omt( i, z + 2 ) )->get_type_id() == oter_type_sub_station ) ) {
3704  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( i, z ), oter_underground_sub_station.id() );
3705  }
3706  }
3707 
3708  // The first lab point is adjacent to a lab, set it a depot (as long as track was actually laid).
3709  const auto create_train_depots = [this, z,
3710  overmap_connection_subway_tunnel]( const oter_id & train_type,
3711  const std::vector<point_om_omt> &train_points ) {
3712  bool is_first_in_pair = true;
3713  std::vector<point_om_omt> extra_route;
3714  for( const point_om_omt &p : train_points ) {
3715  tripoint_om_omt i( p, z );
3716  if( is_first_in_pair ) {
3717  const std::vector<tripoint_om_omt> subway_possible_loc {
3718  i + point_north,
3719  i + point_south,
3720  i + point_east,
3721  i + point_west };
3722  extra_route.clear();
3723  ter_set( i, oter_empty_rock.id() ); // this clears marked tiles
3724  bool is_depot_generated = false;
3725  for( const tripoint_om_omt &subway_loc : subway_possible_loc ) {
3726  if( !is_depot_generated &&
3727  is_ot_match( "subway", ter( subway_loc ), ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
3728  extra_route.push_back( i.xy() );
3729  extra_route.push_back( subway_loc.xy() );
3730  connect_closest_points( extra_route, z, *overmap_connection_subway_tunnel );
3731 
3732  ter_set( i, train_type );
3733  is_depot_generated = true; // only one connection to depot
3734  } else if( is_ot_match( "open_air", ter( subway_loc ),
3735  ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
3736  // clear marked
3737  ter_set( subway_loc, oter_empty_rock.id() );
3738  } else if( is_ot_match( "field", ter( subway_loc ),
3739  ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
3740  // clear marked
3741  ter_set( subway_loc, oter_solid_earth.id() );
3742  }
3743  }
3744  }
3745  is_first_in_pair = !is_first_in_pair;
3746  }
3747  };
3748  create_train_depots( oter_lab_train_depot.id(), lab_train_points );
3749  create_train_depots( oter_central_lab_train_depot.id(), central_lab_train_points );
3750 
3751  for( city &i : cities ) {
3752  tripoint_om_omt omt_pos( i.pos, z );
3753  tripoint_om_sm sm_pos = project_to<coords::sm>( omt_pos );
3754  tripoint_abs_sm abs_pos = project_combine( pos(), sm_pos );
3755  // Normal subways are present at z == -2, but filtering for the terrain would be much nicer
3756  if( z == -2 ) {
3757  spawn_mon_group( mongroup( GROUP_SUBWAY_CITY, abs_pos, i.size * i.size * 2 ),
3758  i.size * 2 );
3759  }
3760  }
3761 
3762  return requires_sub;
3763 }

◆ lay_out_connection()

pf::directed_path< point_om_omt > overmap::lay_out_connection ( const overmap_connection &  connection,
const point_om_omt &  source,
const point_om_omt &  dest,
int  z,
bool  must_be_unexplored 
) const
private

Definition at line 5952 of file overmap.cpp.

5955 {
5956  const pf::two_node_scoring_fn<point_om_omt> estimate =
5957  [&]( pf::directed_node<point_om_omt> cur, std::optional<pf::directed_node<point_om_omt>> prev ) {
5958  const oter_id id = ter( tripoint_om_omt( cur.pos, z ) );
5959 
5960  const overmap_connection::subtype *subtype = connection.pick_subtype_for( id );
5961 
5962  if( !subtype ) {
5963  return pf::node_score::rejected; // No option for this terrain.
5964  }
5965 
5966  const bool existing_connection = connection.has( id );
5967 
5968  // Only do this check if it needs to be unexplored and there isn't already a connection.
5969  if( must_be_unexplored && !existing_connection ) {
5970  // If this must be unexplored, check if we've already got a submap generated.
5971  const bool existing_submap = is_omt_generated( tripoint_om_omt( cur.pos, z ) );
5972 
5973  // If there is an existing submap, this area has already been explored and this
5974  // isn't a valid placement.
5975  if( existing_submap ) {
5976  return pf::node_score::rejected;
5977  }
5978  }
5979 
5980  if( existing_connection && id->is_rotatable() && cur.dir != om_direction::type::invalid &&
5981  !om_direction::are_parallel( id->get_dir(), cur.dir ) ) {
5982  return pf::node_score::rejected; // Can't intersect.
5983  }
5984 
5985  if( prev && prev->dir != om_direction::type::invalid && prev->dir != cur.dir ) {
5986  // Direction has changed.
5987  const oter_id &prev_id = ter( tripoint_om_omt( prev->pos, z ) );
5988  const overmap_connection::subtype *prev_subtype = connection.pick_subtype_for( prev_id );
5989 
5990  if( !prev_subtype || !prev_subtype->allows_turns() ) {
5991  return pf::node_score::rejected;
5992  }
5993  }
5994 
5995  const int dist = subtype->is_orthogonal() ?
5996  manhattan_dist( dest, cur.pos ) :
5997  trig_dist( dest, cur.pos );
5998  const int existency_mult = existing_connection ? 1 : 5; // Prefer existing connections.
5999 
6000  return pf::node_score( subtype->basic_cost, existency_mult * dist );
6001  };
6002 
6003  return pf::greedy_path( source, dest, point_om_omt( OMAPX, OMAPY ), estimate );
6004 }
overmap_connection::subtype::allows_turns
bool allows_turns() const
Definition: overmap_connection.h:32
overmap::is_omt_generated
bool is_omt_generated(const tripoint_om_omt &loc) const
Returns whether or not the location has been generated (e.g.
Definition: overmap.cpp:7336
point_om_omt

◆ lay_out_street()

pf::directed_path< point_om_omt > overmap::lay_out_street ( const overmap_connection &  connection,
const point_om_omt &  source,
om_direction::type  dir,
size_t  len 
) const
private

Definition at line 6023 of file overmap.cpp.

6025 {
6026  const tripoint_om_omt from( source, 0 );
6027  // See if we need to make another one "step" further.
6028  const tripoint_om_omt en_pos = from + om_direction::displace( dir, len + 1 );
6029  if( inbounds( en_pos, 1 ) && connection.has( ter( en_pos ) ) ) {
6030  ++len;
6031  }
6032 
6033  size_t actual_len = 0;
6034 
6035  while( actual_len < len ) {
6036  const tripoint_om_omt pos = from + om_direction::displace( dir, actual_len );
6037 
6038  if( !inbounds( pos, 1 ) ) {
6039  break; // Don't approach overmap bounds.
6040  }
6041 
6042  const oter_id &ter_id = ter( pos );
6043 
6044  if( ter_id->is_river() || ter_id->is_ravine() || ter_id->is_ravine_edge() ||
6045  !connection.pick_subtype_for( ter_id ) ) {
6046  break;
6047  }
6048 
6049  bool collided = false;
6050  int collisions = 0;
6051  for( int i = -1; i <= 1; i++ ) {
6052  if( collided ) {
6053  break;
6054  }
6055  for( int j = -1; j <= 1; j++ ) {
6056  const tripoint_om_omt checkp = pos + tripoint( i, j, 0 );
6057 
6058  if( checkp != pos + om_direction::displace( dir, 1 ) &&
6059  checkp != pos + om_direction::displace( om_direction::opposite( dir ), 1 ) &&
6060  checkp != pos ) {
6061  if( ter( checkp )->get_type_id() == oter_type_road ) {
6062  collisions++;
6063  }
6064  }
6065  }
6066 
6067  //Stop roads from running right next to each other
6068  if( collisions >= 3 ) {
6069  collided = true;
6070  break;
6071  }
6072  }
6073  if( collided ) {
6074  break;
6075  }
6076 
6077  ++actual_len;
6078 
6079  if( actual_len > 1 && connection.has( ter_id ) ) {
6080  break; // Stop here.
6081  }
6082  }
6083 
6084  return straight_path( source, dir, actual_len );
6085 }

◆ move_hordes()

void overmap::move_hordes ( )
private

Definition at line 4033 of file overmap.cpp.

4034 {
4035  // Prevent hordes to be moved twice by putting them in here after moving.
4036  decltype( zg ) tmpzg;
4037  //MOVE ZOMBIE GROUPS
4038  for( auto it = zg.begin(); it != zg.end(); ) {
4039  mongroup &mg = it->second;
4040  if( !mg.horde || mg.behaviour == mongroup::horde_behaviour::nemesis ) {
4041  //nemesis hordes have their own move function
4042  ++it;
4043  continue;
4044  }
4045 
4046  if( mg.behaviour == mongroup::horde_behaviour::none ) {
4047  mg.behaviour =
4048  one_in( 2 ) ? mongroup::horde_behaviour::city : mongroup::horde_behaviour::roam;
4049  }
4050 
4051  // Gradually decrease interest.
4052  mg.dec_interest( 1 );
4053 
4054  if( ( mg.abs_pos.xy() == mg.target ) || mg.interest <= 15 ) {
4055  mg.wander( *this );
4056  }
4057 
4058  // Decrease movement chance according to the terrain we're currently on.
4059  const oter_id &walked_into = ter( project_to<coords::omt>( mg.rel_pos() ) );
4060  int movement_chance = 1;
4061  if( walked_into == oter_forest || walked_into == oter_forest_water ) {
4062  movement_chance = 3;
4063  } else if( walked_into == oter_forest_thick ) {
4064  movement_chance = 6;
4065  } else if( walked_into == oter_river_center ) {
4066  movement_chance = 10;
4067  }
4068 
4069  // If the average horde speed is 50% that of normal, then the chance to
4070  // move should be 1/2 what it would be if the speed was 100%.
4071  // Since the max speed for a horde is one map space per 2.5 minutes,
4072  // choose that to be the speed of the fastest horde monster, which is
4073  // roughly 200 at the time of writing. So a horde with average speed
4074  // 200 or over will move at max speed, and slower hordes will move less
4075  // frequently. The average horde speed for regular Z's is around 100,
4076  // or one space per 5 minutes.
4077  if( one_in( movement_chance ) && rng( 0, 100 ) < mg.interest && rng( 0, 200 ) < mg.avg_speed() ) {
4078  // TODO: Handle moving to adjacent overmaps.
4079  if( mg.abs_pos.x() > mg.target.x() ) {
4080  mg.abs_pos.x()--;
4081  }
4082  if( mg.abs_pos.x() < mg.target.x() ) {
4083  mg.abs_pos.x()++;
4084  }
4085  if( mg.abs_pos.y() > mg.target.y() ) {
4086  mg.abs_pos.y()--;
4087  }
4088  if( mg.abs_pos.y() < mg.target.y() ) {
4089  mg.abs_pos.y()++;
4090  }
4091 
4092  // Erase the group at it's old location, add the group with the new location
4093  tmpzg.emplace( mg.rel_pos(), mg );
4094  zg.erase( it++ );
4095  } else {
4096  ++it;
4097  }
4098  }
4099  // and now back into the monster group map.
4100  zg.insert( tmpzg.begin(), tmpzg.end() );
4101 
4102  if( get_option<bool>( "WANDER_SPAWNS" ) ) {
4103 
4104  // Re-absorb zombies into hordes.
4105  // Scan over monsters outside the player's view and place them back into hordes.
4106  auto monster_map_it = monster_map.begin();
4107  while( monster_map_it != monster_map.end() ) {
4108  const tripoint_om_sm &p = monster_map_it->first;
4109  monster &this_monster = monster_map_it->second;
4110 
4111  // Only zombies on z-level 0 may join hordes.
4112  if( p.z() != 0 ) {
4113  monster_map_it++;
4114  continue;
4115  }
4116 
4117  // Check if the monster is a zombie.
4118  const mtype &type = *this_monster.type;
4119  if(
4120  !type.species.count( species_ZOMBIE ) || // Only add zombies to hordes.
4121  this_monster.get_speed() <= 30 || // So are very slow zombies, like crawling zombies.
4122  !this_monster.will_join_horde( INT_MAX ) || // So are zombies who won't join a horde of any size.
4123  !this_monster.mission_ids.empty() // We mustn't delete monsters that are related to missions.
4124  ) {
4125  // Don't delete the monster, just increment the iterator.
4126  monster_map_it++;
4127  continue;
4128  }
4129 
4130  // Only monsters in the open (fields, forests, roads) are eligible to wander
4131  const oter_id &om_here = ter( project_to<coords::omt>( p ) );
4132  if( !is_ot_match( "field", om_here, ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
4133  if( !is_ot_match( "road", om_here, ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
4134  if( !is_ot_match( "forest", om_here, ot_match_type::prefix ) ) {
4135  if( !is_ot_match( "swamp", om_here, ot_match_type::prefix ) ) {
4136  monster_map_it++;
4137  continue;
4138  }
4139  }
4140  }
4141  }
4142 
4143  // Scan for compatible hordes in this area, selecting the largest.
4144  mongroup *add_to_group = nullptr;
4145  auto group_bucket = zg.equal_range( p );
4146  std::vector<monster>::size_type add_to_horde_size = 0;
4147  std::for_each( group_bucket.first, group_bucket.second,
4148  [&]( std::pair<const tripoint_om_sm, mongroup> &horde_entry ) {
4149  mongroup &horde = horde_entry.second;
4150 
4151  // We only absorb zombies into GROUP_ZOMBIE hordes
4152  if( horde.horde && !horde.monsters.empty() && horde.type == GROUP_ZOMBIE &&
4153  horde.monsters.size() > add_to_horde_size ) {
4154  add_to_group = &horde;
4155  add_to_horde_size = horde.monsters.size();
4156  }
4157  } );
4158 
4159  // Check again if the zombie will join the largest horde, now that we know the accurate size.
4160  if( this_monster.will_join_horde( add_to_horde_size ) ) {
4161  // If there is no horde to add the monster to, create one.
4162  if( add_to_group == nullptr ) {
4163  tripoint_abs_sm abs_pos = project_combine( pos(), p );
4164  mongroup m( GROUP_ZOMBIE, abs_pos, 0 );
4165  m.horde = true;
4166  m.monsters.push_back( this_monster );
4167  m.interest = 0; // Ensures that we will select a new target.
4168  add_mon_group( m );
4169  } else {
4170  add_to_group->monsters.push_back( this_monster );
4171  }
4172  } else { // Bad luck--the zombie would have joined a larger horde, but not this one. Skip.
4173  // Don't delete the monster, just increment the iterator.
4174  monster_map_it++;
4175  continue;
4176  }
4177 
4178  // Delete the monster, continue iterating.
4179  monster_map_it = monster_map.erase( monster_map_it );
4180  }
4181  }
4182 }

◆ move_nemesis()

void overmap::move_nemesis ( )
private

Definition at line 4184 of file overmap.cpp.

4185 {
4186  // Prevent hordes to be moved twice by putting them in here after moving.
4187  decltype( zg ) tmpzg;
4188  //cycle through zombie groups, skip non-nemesis hordes
4189  for( std::multimap<tripoint_om_sm, mongroup>::iterator it = zg.begin(); it != zg.end(); ) {
4190  mongroup &mg = it->second;
4191  if( !mg.horde || mg.behaviour != mongroup::horde_behaviour::nemesis ) {
4192  ++it;
4193  continue;
4194  }
4195 
4196  point_abs_om omp;
4197  tripoint_om_sm local_sm;
4198  std::tie( omp, local_sm ) = project_remain<coords::om>( mg.abs_pos );
4199 
4200  // Decrease movement chance according to the terrain we're currently on.
4201  // Hordes will tend toward roads / open fields and path around specials.
4202  const oter_id &walked_into = ter( project_to<coords::omt>( local_sm ) );
4203  int movement_chance = 25;
4204  if( is_ot_match( "road", walked_into, ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
4205  movement_chance = 1;
4206  } else if( is_ot_match( "field", walked_into, ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
4207  movement_chance = 3;
4208  } else if( is_ot_match( "forest", walked_into, ot_match_type::prefix ) ||
4209  is_ot_match( "swamp", walked_into, ot_match_type::prefix ) ||
4210  is_ot_match( "bridge", walked_into, ot_match_type::prefix ) ) {
4211  movement_chance = 6;
4212  } else if( is_ot_match( "river", walked_into, ot_match_type::prefix ) ) {
4213  movement_chance = 10;
4214  }
4215 
4216  //update the nemesis coordinates in abs_sm for movement across overmaps
4217  if( one_in( movement_chance ) && rng( 0, 200 ) < mg.avg_speed() ) {
4218  if( mg.abs_pos.x() > mg.nemesis_target.x() ) {
4219  mg.abs_pos.x()--;
4220  }
4221  if( mg.abs_pos.x() < mg.nemesis_target.x() ) {
4222  mg.abs_pos.x()++;
4223  }
4224  if( mg.abs_pos.y() > mg.nemesis_target.y() ) {
4225  mg.abs_pos.y()--;
4226  }
4227  if( mg.abs_pos.y() < mg.nemesis_target.y() ) {
4228  mg.abs_pos.y()++;
4229  }
4230 
4231  //if the nemesis horde is on the same overmap as its target
4232  //update the horde's om_sm coords from the abs_sm so it can spawn in correctly
4233  if( project_to<coords::om>( mg.nemesis_target ) == omp ) {
4234 
4235  // Erase the group at its old location, add the group with the new location
4236  tmpzg.emplace( mg.rel_pos(), mg );
4237  zg.erase( it++ );
4238 
4239  //there is only one nemesis horde, so we can stop looping after we move it
4240  break;
4241 
4242  }
4243 
4244  //only one nemesis, so we break after moving it
4245  break;
4246 
4247  } else {
4248  //and we also break if it doesnt move
4249  break;
4250  }
4251  }
4252  // and now back into the monster group map.
4253  zg.insert( tmpzg.begin(), tmpzg.end() );
4254 
4255 }

5558 {
5559  const city_settings &city_spec = settings->city_spec;
5560  int shop_radius = city_spec.shop_radius;
5561  int park_radius = city_spec.park_radius;
5562 
5563  int shop_sigma = city_spec.shop_sigma;
5564  int park_sigma = city_spec.park_sigma;
5565 
5566  //Normally distribute shops and parks
5567  //Clamp at 1/2 radius to prevent houses from spawning in the city center.
5568  //Parks are nearly guaranteed to have a non-zero chance of spawning anywhere in the city.
5569  int shop_normal = shop_radius;
5570  if( shop_sigma > 0 ) {
5571  shop_normal = std::max( shop_normal, static_cast<int>( normal_roll( shop_radius, shop_sigma ) ) );
5572  }
5573  int park_normal = park_radius;
5574  if( park_sigma > 0 ) {
5575  park_normal = std::max( park_normal, static_cast<int>( normal_roll( park_radius, park_sigma ) ) );
5576  }
5577  auto building_type_to_pick = [&]() {
5578  if( shop_normal > town_dist ) {
5579  return std::mem_fn( &city_settings::pick_shop );
5580  } else if( park_normal > town_dist ) {
5581  return std::mem_fn( &city_settings::pick_park );
5582  } else {
5583  return std::mem_fn( &city_settings::pick_house );
5584  }
5585  };
5586  auto pick_building = building_type_to_pick();
5587  overmap_special_id ret;
5588  do {
5589  ret = pick_building( city_spec );
5590  } while( !ret->get_constraints().city_size.contains( town_size ) );
5591  return ret;
5592 }

◆ place_cities()

void overmap::place_cities ( )
private

Definition at line 5438 of file overmap.cpp.

5439 {
5440  int op_city_spacing = get_option<int>( "CITY_SPACING" );
5441  int op_city_size = get_option<int>( "CITY_SIZE" );
5442  int max_urbanity = get_option<int>( "OVERMAP_MAXIMUM_URBANITY" );
5443  if( op_city_size <= 0 ) {
5444  return;
5445  }
5446  // make sure city size adjust is never high enough to drop op_city_size below 2
5447  int city_size_adjust = std::min( urbanity - static_cast<int>( forestosity / 2.0f ),
5448  -1 * op_city_size + 2 );
5449  int city_space_adjust = urbanity / 2;
5450  int max_city_size = std::min( op_city_size + city_size_adjust, op_city_size * max_urbanity );
5451  if( max_city_size < op_city_size ) {
5452  // funny things happen if max_city_size is less than op_city_size.
5453  max_city_size = op_city_size;
5454  }
5455  if( op_city_spacing > 0 ) {
5456  city_space_adjust = std::min( city_space_adjust, op_city_spacing - 2 );
5457  op_city_spacing = op_city_spacing - city_space_adjust + static_cast<int>( forestosity );
5458  }
5459  // make sure not to get too extreme on the spacing if you go way far.
5460  op_city_spacing = std::min( op_city_spacing, 10 );
5461 
5462  // spacing dictates how much of the map is covered in cities
5463  // city | cities | size N cities per overmap
5464  // spacing | % of map | 2 | 4 | 8 | 12 | 16
5465  // 0 | ~99 |2025 | 506 | 126 | 56 | 31
5466  // 1 | 50 |1012 | 253 | 63 | 28 | 15
5467  // 2 | 25 | 506 | 126 | 31 | 14 | 7
5468  // 3 | 12 | 253 | 63 | 15 | 7 | 3
5469  // 4 | 6 | 126 | 31 | 7 | 3 | 1
5470  // 5 | 3 | 63 | 15 | 3 | 1 | 0
5471  // 6 | 1 | 31 | 7 | 1 | 0 | 0
5472  // 7 | 0 | 15 | 3 | 0 | 0 | 0
5473  // 8 | 0 | 7 | 1 | 0 | 0 | 0
5474 
5475  const double omts_per_overmap = OMAPX * OMAPY;
5476  const double city_map_coverage_ratio = 1.0 / std::pow( 2.0, op_city_spacing );
5477  const double omts_per_city = ( op_city_size * 2 + 1 ) * ( max_city_size * 2 + 1 ) * 3 / 4.0;
5478 
5479  // how many cities on this overmap?
5480  int num_cities_on_this_overmap = 0;
5481  std::vector<city> cities_to_place;
5482  for( const city &c : city::get_all() ) {
5483  if( c.pos_om == pos() ) {
5484  num_cities_on_this_overmap++;
5485  cities_to_place.emplace_back( c );
5486  }
5487  }
5488 
5489  const bool use_random_cities = city::get_all().empty();
5490 
5491  // Random cities if no cities were defined in regional settings
5492  if( use_random_cities ) {
5493  num_cities_on_this_overmap = roll_remainder( omts_per_overmap * city_map_coverage_ratio /
5494  omts_per_city );
5495  }
5496 
5497  const overmap_connection_id &overmap_connection_intra_city_road =
5498  settings->overmap_connection.intra_city_road_connection;
5499  const overmap_connection &local_road( *overmap_connection_intra_city_road );
5500 
5501  // if there is only a single free tile, the probability of NOT finding it after MAX_PLACEMENT_ATTEMPTS attempts
5502  // is (1 - 1/(OMAPX * OMAPY))^MAX_PLACEMENT_ATTEMPTS ≈ 36% for the OMAPX=OMAPY=180 and MAX_PLACEMENT_ATTEMPTS=OMAPX * OMAPY
5503  const int MAX_PLACEMENT_ATTEMPTS = 50;//OMAPX * OMAPY;
5504  int placement_attempts = 0;
5505 
5506  // place a seed for num_cities_on_this_overmap cities, and maybe one more
5507  while( cities.size() < static_cast<size_t>( num_cities_on_this_overmap ) &&
5508  placement_attempts < MAX_PLACEMENT_ATTEMPTS ) {
5509  placement_attempts++;
5510 
5511  tripoint_om_omt p;
5512  city tmp;
5513  tmp.pos_om = pos();
5514  if( use_random_cities ) {
5515  // randomly make some cities smaller or larger
5516  int size = rng( op_city_size - 1, max_city_size );
5517  if( one_in( 3 ) ) { // 33% tiny
5518  size = size * 1 / 3;
5519  } else if( one_in( 2 ) ) { // 33% small
5520  size = size * 2 / 3;
5521  } else if( one_in( 2 ) ) { // 17% large
5522  size = size * 3 / 2;
5523  } else { // 17% huge
5524  size = size * 2;
5525  }
5526  // Ensure that cities are at least size 2, as city of size 1 is just a crossroad with no buildings at all
5527  size = std::max( size, 2 );
5528  size = std::min( size, 55 );
5529  // TODO: put cities closer to the edge when they can span overmaps
5530  // don't draw cities across the edge of the map, they will get clipped
5531  point_om_omt c( rng( size - 1, OMAPX - size ), rng( size - 1, OMAPY - size ) );
5532  p = tripoint_om_omt( c, 0 );
5533  if( ter( p ) == settings->default_oter[OVERMAP_DEPTH] ) {
5534  placement_attempts = 0;
5535  ter_set( p, oter_road_nesw ); // every city starts with an intersection
5536  tmp.pos = p.xy();
5537  tmp.size = size;
5538  }
5539  } else {
5540  placement_attempts = 0;
5541  tmp = random_entry( cities_to_place );
5542  p = tripoint_om_omt( tmp.pos, 0 );
5543  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( tmp.pos, 0 ), oter_road_nesw );
5544  }
5545  if( placement_attempts == 0 ) {
5546  cities.push_back( tmp );
5547  const om_direction::type start_dir = om_direction::random();
5548  om_direction::type cur_dir = start_dir;
5549 
5550  do {
5551  build_city_street( local_road, tmp.pos, tmp.size, cur_dir, tmp );
5552  } while( ( cur_dir = om_direction::turn_right( cur_dir ) ) != start_dir );
5553  }
5554  }
5555 }

void overmap::place_forest_trailheads ( )
private

Definition at line 4504 of file overmap.cpp.

4505 {
4506  // No trailheads if there are no cities.
4507  const int city_size = get_option<int>( "CITY_SIZE" );
4508  if( city_size <= 0 ) {
4509  return;
4510  }
4511 
4512  // Trailheads may be placed if all of the following are true:
4513  // 1. we're at a forest_trail_end_north/south/west/east,
4514  // 2. we're within trailhead_road_distance from an existing road
4515  // 3. rng rolls a success for our trailhead_chance from the configuration
4516  // 4. the trailhead special we've picked can be placed in the selected location
4517 
4518  const auto trailhead_close_to_road = [&]( const tripoint_om_omt & trailhead ) {
4519  bool close = false;
4520  for( const tripoint_om_omt &nearby_point : closest_points_first(
4521  trailhead,
4522  settings->forest_trail.trailhead_road_distance
4523  ) ) {
4524  if( check_ot( "road", ot_match_type::contains, nearby_point ) ) {
4525  close = true;
4526  }
4527  }
4528  return close;
4529  };
4530 
4531  const auto try_place_trailhead_special = [&]( const tripoint_om_omt & trail_end,
4532  const om_direction::type & dir ) {
4533  overmap_special_id trailhead = settings->forest_trail.trailheads.pick();
4534  if( one_in( settings->forest_trail.trailhead_chance ) &&
4535  trailhead_close_to_road( trail_end ) &&
4536  can_place_special( *trailhead, trail_end, dir, false ) ) {
4537  const city &nearest_city = get_nearest_city( trail_end );
4538  place_special( *trailhead, trail_end, dir, nearest_city, false, false );
4539  }
4540  };
4541 
4542  for( int i = 2; i < OMAPX - 2; i++ ) {
4543  for( int j = 2; j < OMAPY - 2; j++ ) {
4544  const tripoint_om_omt p( i, j, 0 );
4545  oter_id oter = ter( p );

4547  try_place_trailhead_special( p, static_cast<om_direction::type>( oter->get_rotation() ) );

◆ place_forest_trails()

void overmap::place_forest_trails ( )
private

Definition at line 4379 of file overmap.cpp.

4380 {
4381  std::unordered_set<point_om_omt> visited;
4382 
4383  const auto is_forest = [&]( const point_om_omt & p ) {
4384  if( !inbounds( p, 1 ) ) {
4385  return false;
4386  }
4387  const oter_id current_terrain = ter( tripoint_om_omt( p, 0 ) );
4388  return current_terrain == oter_forest || current_terrain == oter_forest_thick ||
4389  current_terrain == oter_forest_water;
4390  };
4391  const forest_trail_settings &forest_trail = settings->forest_trail;
4392 
4393  for( int i = 0; i < OMAPX; i++ ) {
4394  for( int j = 0; j < OMAPY; j++ ) {
4395  tripoint_om_omt seed_point( i, j, 0 );
4396 
4397  oter_id oter = ter( seed_point );
4398  if( !is_ot_match( "forest", oter, ot_match_type::prefix ) ) {
4399  continue;
4400  }
4401 
4402  // If we've already visited this point, we don't need to
4403  // process it since it's already part of another forest.
4404  if( visited.find( seed_point.xy() ) != visited.end() ) {
4405  continue;
4406  }
4407 
4408  // Get the contiguous forest from this point.
4409  std::vector<point_om_omt> forest_points =
4410  ff::point_flood_fill_4_connected( seed_point.xy(), visited, is_forest );
4411 
4412  // If we don't have enough points to build a trail, move on.
4413  if( forest_points.empty() ||
4414  forest_points.size() < static_cast<std::vector<point>::size_type>
4415  ( forest_trail.minimum_forest_size ) ) {
4416  continue;
4417  }
4418 
4419  // If we don't rng a forest based on our settings, move on.
4420  if( !one_in( forest_trail.chance ) ) {
4421  continue;
4422  }
4423 
4424  // Get the north and south most points in the forest.
4425  auto north_south_most = std::minmax_element( forest_points.begin(),
4426  forest_points.end(), []( const point_om_omt & lhs, const point_om_omt & rhs ) {
4427  return lhs.y() < rhs.y();
4428  } );
4429 
4430  // Get the west and east most points in the forest.
4431  auto west_east_most = std::minmax_element( forest_points.begin(),
4432  forest_points.end(), []( const point_om_omt & lhs, const point_om_omt & rhs ) {
4433  return lhs.x() < rhs.x();
4434  } );
4435 
4436  // We'll use these points later as points that are guaranteed to be
4437  // at a boundary and will form a good foundation for the trail system.
4438  point_om_omt northmost = *north_south_most.first;
4439  point_om_omt southmost = *north_south_most.second;
4440  point_om_omt westmost = *west_east_most.first;
4441  point_om_omt eastmost = *west_east_most.second;
4442 
4443  // Do a simplistic calculation of the center of the forest (rather than
4444  // calculating the actual centroid--it's not that important) to have another
4445  // good point to form the foundation of the trail system.
4446  point_om_omt center( westmost.x() + ( eastmost.x() - westmost.x() ) / 2,
4447  northmost.y() + ( southmost.y() - northmost.y() ) / 2 );
4448 
4449  point_om_omt center_point = center;
4450 
4451  // Because we didn't do the centroid of a concave polygon, there's no
4452  // guarantee that our center point is actually within the bounds of the
4453  // forest. Just find the point within our set that is closest to our
4454  // center point and use that.
4455  point_om_omt actual_center_point =
4456  *std::min_element( forest_points.begin(), forest_points.end(),
4457  [&center_point]( const point_om_omt & lhs, const point_om_omt & rhs ) {
4458  return square_dist( lhs, center_point ) < square_dist( rhs,
4459  center_point );
4460  } );
4461 
4462  // Figure out how many random points we'll add to our trail system, based on the forest
4463  // size and our configuration.
4464  int max_random_points = forest_trail.random_point_min + forest_points.size() /
4465  forest_trail.random_point_size_scalar;
4466  max_random_points = std::min( max_random_points, forest_trail.random_point_max );
4467 
4468  // Start with the center...
4469  std::vector<point_om_omt> chosen_points = { actual_center_point };
4470 
4471  // ...and then add our random points.
4472  int random_point_count = 0;
4473  std::shuffle( forest_points.begin(), forest_points.end(), rng_get_engine() );
4474  for( auto &random_point : forest_points ) {
4475  if( random_point_count >= max_random_points ) {
4476  break;
4477  }
4478  random_point_count++;
4479  chosen_points.emplace_back( random_point );
4480  }
4481 
4482  // Add our north/south/west/east-most points based on our configuration.
4483  if( one_in( forest_trail.border_point_chance ) ) {
4484  chosen_points.emplace_back( northmost );
4485  }
4486  if( one_in( forest_trail.border_point_chance ) ) {
4487  chosen_points.emplace_back( southmost );
4488  }
4489  if( one_in( forest_trail.border_point_chance ) ) {
4490  chosen_points.emplace_back( westmost );
4491  }
4492  if( one_in( forest_trail.border_point_chance ) ) {
4493  chosen_points.emplace_back( eastmost );
4494  }
4495 
4496  // Finally, connect all the points and make a forest trail out of them.
4497  const overmap_connection_id &overmap_connection_forest_trail =
4498  settings->overmap_connection.trail_connection;
4499  connect_closest_points( chosen_points, 0, *overmap_connection_forest_trail );
4500  }
4501  }
4502 }

4559  for( int y = 0; y < OMAPY; y++ ) {
4560  const tripoint_om_omt p( x, y, 0 );
4561  const oter_id &oter = ter( p );
4562 
4563  // At this point in the process, we only want to consider converting the terrain into
4564  // a forest if it's currently the default terrain type (e.g. a field).
4565  if( oter != default_oter_id ) {
4566  continue;
4567  }

void overmap::place_lakes ( )
private

Definition at line 4582 of file overmap.cpp.

4583 {
4584  const om_noise::om_noise_layer_lake f( global_base_point(), g->get_seed() );
4585 
4586  const auto is_lake = [&]( const point_om_omt & p ) {
4587  // credit to ehughsbaird for thinking up this inbounds solution to infinite flood fill lag.
4588  bool inbounds = p.x() > -5 && p.y() > -5 && p.x() < OMAPX + 5 && p.y() < OMAPY + 5;
4589  if( !inbounds ) {
4590  return false;
4591  }
4592  return f.noise_at( p ) > settings->overmap_lake.noise_threshold_lake;
4593  };
4594 
4595  const oter_id lake_surface( "lake_surface" );
4596  const oter_id lake_shore( "lake_shore" );
4597  const oter_id lake_water_cube( "lake_water_cube" );
4598  const oter_id lake_bed( "lake_bed" );
4599 
4600  // We'll keep track of our visited lake points so we don't repeat the work.
4601  std::unordered_set<point_om_omt> visited;
4602 
4603  for( int i = 0; i < OMAPX; i++ ) {
4604  for( int j = 0; j < OMAPY; j++ ) {
4605  point_om_omt seed_point( i, j );
4606  if( visited.find( seed_point ) != visited.end() ) {
4607  continue;
4608  }
4609 
4610  // It's a lake if it exceeds the noise threshold defined in the region settings.
4611  if( !is_lake( seed_point ) ) {
4612  continue;
4613  }
4614 
4615  // We're going to flood-fill our lake so that we can consider the entire lake when evaluating it
4616  // for placement, even when the lake runs off the edge of the current overmap.
4617  std::vector<point_om_omt> lake_points =
4618  ff::point_flood_fill_4_connected( seed_point, visited, is_lake );
4619 
4620  // If this lake doesn't exceed our minimum size threshold, then skip it. We can use this to
4621  // exclude the tiny lakes that don't provide interesting map features and exist mostly as a
4622  // noise artifact.
4623  if( lake_points.size() < static_cast<std::vector<point>::size_type>
4624  ( settings->overmap_lake.lake_size_min ) ) {
4625  continue;
4626  }
4627 
4628  // Build a set of "lake" points. We're actually going to combine both the lake points
4629  // we just found AND all of the rivers on the map, because we want our lakes to write
4630  // over any rivers that are placed already. Note that the assumption here is that river
4631  // overmap generation (e.g. place_rivers) runs BEFORE lake overmap generation.
4632  std::unordered_set<point_om_omt> lake_set;
4633  for( auto &p : lake_points ) {
4634  lake_set.emplace( p );
4635  }
4636 
4637  for( int x = 0; x < OMAPX; x++ ) {
4638  for( int y = 0; y < OMAPY; y++ ) {
4639  const tripoint_om_omt p( x, y, 0 );
4640  if( ter( p )->is_river() ) {
4641  lake_set.emplace( p.xy() );
4642  }
4643  }
4644  }
4645 
4646  // Iterate through all of our lake points, rejecting the ones that are out of bounds. For
4647  // those that are inbounds, look at the 8 adjacent locations and see if they are also part
4648  // of our lake points set. If they are, that means that this location is entirely surrounded
4649  // by lake and should be considered a lake surface. If at least one adjacent location is not
4650  // part of this lake points set, that means this location should be considered a lake shore.
4651  // Either way, make the determination and set the overmap terrain.
4652  for( auto &p : lake_points ) {
4653  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
4654  continue;
4655  }
4656 
4657  bool shore = false;
4658  for( int ni = -1; ni <= 1 && !shore; ni++ ) {
4659  for( int nj = -1; nj <= 1 && !shore; nj++ ) {
4660  const point_om_omt n = p + point( ni, nj );
4661  if( lake_set.find( n ) == lake_set.end() ) {
4662  shore = true;
4663  }
4664  }
4665  }
4666 
4667  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( p, 0 ), shore ? lake_shore : lake_surface );
4668 
4669  // If this is not a shore, we'll make our subsurface lake cubes and beds.
4670  if( !shore ) {
4671  for( int z = -1; z > settings->overmap_lake.lake_depth; z-- ) {
4672  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( p, z ), lake_water_cube );
4673  }
4674  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( p, settings->overmap_lake.lake_depth ), lake_bed );
4675  }
4676  }
4677 
4678  // We're going to attempt to connect some points on this lake to the nearest river.
4679  const auto connect_lake_to_closest_river =
4680  [&]( const point_om_omt & lake_connection_point ) {
4681  int closest_distance = -1;
4682  point_om_omt closest_point;
4683  for( int x = 0; x < OMAPX; x++ ) {
4684  for( int y = 0; y < OMAPY; y++ ) {
4685  const tripoint_om_omt p( x, y, 0 );
4686  if( !ter( p )->is_river() ) {
4687  continue;
4688  }
4689  const int distance = square_dist( lake_connection_point, p.xy() );
4690  if( distance < closest_distance || closest_distance < 0 ) {
4691  closest_point = p.xy();
4692  closest_distance = distance;
4693  }
4694  }
4695  }
4696 
4697  if( closest_distance > 0 ) {
4698  place_river( closest_point, lake_connection_point );
4699  }
4700  };
4701 
4702  // Get the north and south most points in our lake.
4703  auto north_south_most = std::minmax_element( lake_points.begin(), lake_points.end(),
4704  []( const point_om_omt & lhs, const point_om_omt & rhs ) {
4705  return lhs.y() < rhs.y();
4706  } );
4707 
4708  point_om_omt northmost = *north_south_most.first;
4709  point_om_omt southmost = *north_south_most.second;
4710 
4711  // It's possible that our northmost/southmost points in the lake are not on this overmap, because our
4712  // lake may extend across multiple overmaps.
4713  if( inbounds( northmost ) ) {
4714  connect_lake_to_closest_river( northmost );
4715  }
4716 
4717  if( inbounds( southmost ) ) {
4718  connect_lake_to_closest_river( southmost );
4719  }
4720  }
4721  }
4722 }

◆ place_mongroups()

void overmap::place_mongroups ( )

6937 {
6938  // Cities can be full of zombies
6939  int city_spawn_threshold = get_option<int>( "SPAWN_CITY_HORDE_THRESHOLD" );
6940  if( city_spawn_threshold > -1 ) {
6941  int city_spawn_chance = get_option<int>( "SPAWN_CITY_HORDE_SMALL_CITY_CHANCE" );
6942  float city_spawn_scalar = get_option<float>( "SPAWN_CITY_HORDE_SCALAR" );
6943  float city_spawn_spread = get_option<float>( "SPAWN_CITY_HORDE_SPREAD" );
6944  float spawn_density = get_option<float>( "SPAWN_DENSITY" );
6945 
6946  for( city &elem : cities ) {
6947  if( elem.size > city_spawn_threshold || !one_in( city_spawn_chance ) ) {
6948 
6949  // with the default numbers (80 scalar, 1 density), a size 16 city
6950  // will produce 1280 zombies.
6951  int desired_zombies = elem.size * city_spawn_scalar * spawn_density;
6952 
6953  float city_effective_radius = elem.size * city_spawn_spread;
6954 
6955  int city_distance_increment = std::ceil( city_effective_radius / 4 );
6956 
6957  tripoint_abs_omt city_center = project_combine( elem.pos_om, tripoint_om_omt( elem.pos, 0 ) );
6958 
6959  std::vector<tripoint_abs_sm> submap_list;
6960 
6961  // gather all of the points in range to test for viable placement of hordes.
6962  for( tripoint_om_omt const &temp_omt : points_in_radius( tripoint_om_omt( elem.pos, 0 ),
6963  static_cast<int>( city_effective_radius ), 0 ) ) {
6964 
6965  // running too close to the edge of the overmap can get us cascading mapgen
6966  if( inbounds( temp_omt, 2 ) ) {
6967 
6968  tripoint_abs_omt target_omt = project_combine( elem.pos_om, temp_omt );
6969 
6970  // right now we're only placing city horde spawns on roads, for simplicity.
6971  // this can be replaced with an OMT flag for later for better flexibility.
6972  if( overmap_buffer.ter( target_omt )->get_type_id() == oter_type_road ) {
6973  tripoint_abs_sm this_sm = project_to<coords::sm>( target_omt );
6974 
6975  // for some reason old style spawns are submap-aligned.
6976  // get all four quadrants for better distribution.
6977  std::vector<tripoint_abs_sm> local_sm_list;
6978  local_sm_list.push_back( this_sm );
6979  local_sm_list.push_back( this_sm + point_east );
6980  local_sm_list.push_back( this_sm + point_south );
6981  local_sm_list.push_back( this_sm + point_south_east );
6982 
6983  // shuffle, then prune submaps based on distance from city center
6984  // this should let us concentrate hordes closer to the center.
6985  // the shuffling is so they aren't all aligned consistently.
6986  int new_size = 4 - ( trig_dist( target_omt, city_center ) / city_distance_increment );
6987  if( new_size > 0 ) {
6988  std::shuffle( local_sm_list.begin(), local_sm_list.end(), rng_get_engine() );
6989  local_sm_list.resize( new_size );
6990 
6991  submap_list.insert( submap_list.end(), local_sm_list.begin(), local_sm_list.end() );
6992  }
6993 
6994  }
6995  }
6996  }
6997 
6998  if( submap_list.empty() ) {
6999  // somehow the city has no roads. this shouldn't happen.
7000  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_OVERMAP,
7001  "tried to add zombie hordes to city %s centered at omt %s, but there were no roads!",
7002  elem.name, city_center.to_string_writable() );
7003  continue;
7004  }
7005 
7006  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_OVERMAP, "adding %i zombies in hordes to city %s centered at omt %s.",
7007  desired_zombies, elem.name, city_center.to_string_writable() );
7008 
7009  // if there aren't enough roads, we'll just reuse them, re-shuffled.
7010  while( desired_zombies > 0 ) {
7011  std::shuffle( submap_list.begin(), submap_list.end(), rng_get_engine() );
7012  for( tripoint_abs_sm const &s : submap_list ) {
7013  if( desired_zombies <= 0 ) {
7014  break;
7015  }
7016  mongroup m( GROUP_ZOMBIE, s, desired_zombies > 10 ? 10 : desired_zombies );
7017 
7018  // with wander_spawns (aka wandering hordes) off, these become 'normal'
7019  // zombie spawns and behave like ants, triffids, fungals, etc.
7020  // they won't try very hard to get placed in the world, so there will
7021  // probably be fewer zombies than expected.
7022  m.horde = true;
7023  if( get_option<bool>( "WANDER_SPAWNS" ) ) {
7024  m.wander( *this );
7025  }
7026  add_mon_group( m );
7027  desired_zombies -= 10;
7028  }
7029  }
7030  }
7031  }
7032  }
7033 
7034  if( get_option<bool>( "DISABLE_ANIMAL_CLASH" ) ) {
7035  // Figure out where swamps are, and place swamp monsters
7036  for( int x = 3; x < OMAPX - 3; x += 7 ) {
7037  for( int y = 3; y < OMAPY - 3; y += 7 ) {
7038  int swamp_count = 0;
7039  for( int sx = x - 3; sx <= x + 3; sx++ ) {
7040  for( int sy = y - 3; sy <= y + 3; sy++ ) {
7041  if( ter( { sx, sy, 0 } ) == oter_forest_water ) {
7042  swamp_count += 2;
7043  }
7044  }
7045  }
7046  if( swamp_count >= 25 ) {
7047  tripoint_om_omt p( x, y, 0 );
7048  float norm_factor = std::abs( GROUP_SWAMP->freq_total / 1000.0f );
7049  unsigned int pop =
7050  std::round( norm_factor * rng( swamp_count * 8, swamp_count * 25 ) );
7051  spawn_mon_group(
7052  mongroup(
7053  GROUP_SWAMP, project_combine( pos(), project_to<coords::sm>( p ) ),
7054  pop ), 3 );
7055  }
7056  }
7057  }
7058  }
7059 
7060  // Figure out where rivers and lakes are, and place appropriate critters
7061  for( int x = 3; x < OMAPX - 3; x += 7 ) {
7062  for( int y = 3; y < OMAPY - 3; y += 7 ) {
7063  int river_count = 0;
7064  for( int sx = x - 3; sx <= x + 3; sx++ ) {
7065  for( int sy = y - 3; sy <= y + 3; sy++ ) {
7066  if( is_lake_or_river( ter( { sx, sy, 0 } ) ) ) {
7067  river_count++;
7068  }
7069  }
7070  }
7071  if( river_count >= 25 && is_lake_or_river( ter( { x, y, 0 } ) ) ) {
7072  tripoint_om_omt p( x, y, 0 );
7073  float norm_factor = std::abs( GROUP_RIVER->freq_total / 1000.0f );
7074  unsigned int pop =
7075  std::round( norm_factor * rng( river_count * 8, river_count * 25 ) );
7076  spawn_mon_group(
7077  mongroup( GROUP_RIVER, project_combine( pos(), project_to<coords::sm>( p ) ),
7078  pop ), 3 );
7079  }
7080  }
7081  }
7082 
7083  // Now place ocean mongroup. Weights may need to be altered.
7084  const om_noise::om_noise_layer_ocean f( global_base_point(), g->get_seed() );
7085  const point_abs_om this_om = pos();
7086  const int northern_ocean = settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_start_north;
7087  const int eastern_ocean = settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_start_east;
7088  const int western_ocean = settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_start_west;
7089  const int southern_ocean = settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_start_south;
7090 
7091  // noise threshold adjuster for deep ocean. Increase to make deep ocean move further from the shore.
7092  constexpr float DEEP_OCEAN_THRESHOLD_ADJUST = 1.25;
7093 
7094  // code taken from place_oceans, but noise threshold increased to determine "deep ocean".
7095  const auto is_deep_ocean = [&]( const point_om_omt & p ) {
7096  // credit to ehughsbaird for thinking up this inbounds solution to infinite flood fill lag.
7097  if( northern_ocean == 0 && eastern_ocean == 0 && western_ocean == 0 && southern_ocean == 0 ) {
7098  // you know you could just turn oceans off in global_settings.json right?
7099  return false;
7100  }
7101  bool inbounds = p.x() > -5 && p.y() > -5 && p.x() < OMAPX + 5 && p.y() < OMAPY + 5;
7102  if( !inbounds ) {
7103  return false;
7104  }
7105  float ocean_adjust = calculate_ocean_gradient( p, this_om );
7106  if( ocean_adjust == 0.0f ) {
7107  // It's too soon! Too soon for an ocean!! ABORT!!!
7108  return false;
7109  }
7110  return f.noise_at( p ) + ocean_adjust > settings->overmap_ocean.noise_threshold_ocean *
7111  DEEP_OCEAN_THRESHOLD_ADJUST;
7112  };
7113 
7114  for( int x = 3; x < OMAPX - 3; x += 7 ) {
7115  for( int y = 3; y < OMAPY - 3; y += 7 ) {
7116  int ocean_count = 0;
7117  for( int sx = x - 3; sx <= x + 3; sx++ ) {
7118  for( int sy = y - 3; sy <= y + 3; sy++ ) {
7119  if( is_ocean( ter( { sx, sy, 0 } ) ) ) {
7120  ocean_count++;
7121  }
7122  }
7123  }
7124  bool am_deep = is_deep_ocean( { x, y } );
7125  if( ocean_count >= 25 ) {
7126  tripoint_om_omt p( x, y, 0 );
7127  if( am_deep ) {
7128  float norm_factor = std::abs( GROUP_OCEAN_DEEP->freq_total / 1000.0f );
7129  unsigned int pop =
7130  std::round( norm_factor * rng( ocean_count * 8, ocean_count * 25 ) );
7131  spawn_mon_group(
7132  mongroup( GROUP_OCEAN_DEEP, project_combine( pos(), project_to<coords::sm>( p ) ),
7133  pop ), 3 );
7134  } else {
7135  float norm_factor = std::abs( GROUP_OCEAN_SHORE->freq_total / 1000.0f );
7136  unsigned int pop =
7137  std::round( norm_factor * rng( ocean_count * 8, ocean_count * 25 ) );
7138  spawn_mon_group(
7139  mongroup( GROUP_OCEAN_SHORE, project_combine( pos(), project_to<coords::sm>( p ) ),
7140  pop ), 3 );
7141  }
7142  }
7143  }
7144  }
7145 }

void overmap::place_oceans ( )
private

Definition at line 4754 of file overmap.cpp.

4755 {
4756  int northern_ocean = settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_start_north;
4757  int eastern_ocean = settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_start_east;
4758  int western_ocean = settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_start_west;
4759  int southern_ocean = settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_start_south;
4760 
4761  const om_noise::om_noise_layer_ocean f( global_base_point(), g->get_seed() );
4762  const point_abs_om this_om = pos();
4763 
4764  const auto is_ocean = [&]( const point_om_omt & p ) {
4765  // credit to ehughsbaird for thinking up this inbounds solution to infinite flood fill lag.
4766  if( northern_ocean == 0 && eastern_ocean == 0 && western_ocean == 0 && southern_ocean == 0 ) {
4767  // you know you could just turn oceans off in global_settings.json right?
4768  return false;
4769  }
4770  bool inbounds = p.x() > -5 && p.y() > -5 && p.x() < OMAPX + 5 && p.y() < OMAPY + 5;
4771  if( !inbounds ) {
4772  return false;
4773  }
4774  float ocean_adjust = calculate_ocean_gradient( p, this_om );
4775  if( ocean_adjust == 0.0f ) {
4776  // It's too soon! Too soon for an ocean!! ABORT!!!
4777  return false;
4778  }
4779  return f.noise_at( p ) + ocean_adjust > settings->overmap_ocean.noise_threshold_ocean;
4780  };
4781 
4782  const oter_id ocean_surface( "ocean_surface" );
4783  const oter_id ocean_shore( "ocean_shore" );
4784  const oter_id ocean_water_cube( "ocean_water_cube" );
4785  const oter_id ocean_bed( "ocean_bed" );
4786 
4787  // This code is repeated from is_lake(), see comments there for explanation.
4788  std::unordered_set<point_om_omt> visited;
4789 
4790  for( int i = 0; i < OMAPX; i++ ) {
4791  for( int j = 0; j < OMAPY; j++ ) {
4792  point_om_omt seed_point( i, j );
4793  if( visited.find( seed_point ) != visited.end() ) {
4794  continue;
4795  }
4796 
4797  if( !is_ocean( seed_point ) ) {
4798  continue;
4799  }
4800 
4801  std::vector<point_om_omt> ocean_points =
4802  ff::point_flood_fill_4_connected( seed_point, visited, is_ocean );
4803 
4804  // Ocean size is checked like lake size, but minimum size is much bigger.
4805  // you could change this, if you want little tiny oceans all over the place.
4806  // I'm not sure why you'd want that. Use place_lakes, my friend.
4807  if( ocean_points.size() < static_cast<std::vector<point>::size_type>
4808  ( settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_size_min ) ) {
4809  continue;
4810  }
4811 
4812  std::unordered_set<point_om_omt> ocean_set;
4813  for( auto &p : ocean_points ) {
4814  ocean_set.emplace( p );
4815  }
4816 
4817  for( int x = 0; x < OMAPX; x++ ) {
4818  for( int y = 0; y < OMAPY; y++ ) {
4819  const tripoint_om_omt p( x, y, 0 );
4820  if( ter( p )->is_river() ) {
4821  ocean_set.emplace( p.xy() );
4822  }
4823  }
4824  }
4825 
4826  for( auto &p : ocean_points ) {
4827  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
4828  continue;
4829  }
4830 
4831  bool shore = false;
4832  for( int ni = -1; ni <= 1 && !shore; ni++ ) {
4833  for( int nj = -1; nj <= 1 && !shore; nj++ ) {
4834  const point_om_omt n = p + point( ni, nj );
4835  if( ocean_set.find( n ) == ocean_set.end() ) {
4836  shore = true;
4837  }
4838  }
4839  }
4840 
4841  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( p, 0 ), shore ? ocean_shore : ocean_surface );
4842 
4843  if( !shore ) {
4844  for( int z = -1; z > settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_depth; z-- ) {
4845  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( p, z ), ocean_water_cube );
4846  }
4847  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( p, settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_depth ), ocean_bed );
4848  }
4849  }
4850 
4851  // We're going to attempt to connect some points to the nearest river.
4852  // This isn't a lake but the code is the same, we can reuse it. Water is water.
4853  const auto connect_lake_to_closest_river =
4854  [&]( const point_om_omt & lake_connection_point ) {
4855  int closest_distance = -1;
4856  point_om_omt closest_point;
4857  for( int x = 0; x < OMAPX; x++ ) {
4858  for( int y = 0; y < OMAPY; y++ ) {
4859  const tripoint_om_omt p( x, y, 0 );
4860  if( !ter( p )->is_river() ) {
4861  continue;
4862  }
4863  const int distance = square_dist( lake_connection_point, p.xy() );
4864  if( distance < closest_distance || closest_distance < 0 ) {
4865  closest_point = p.xy();
4866  closest_distance = distance;
4867  }
4868  }
4869  }
4870 
4871  if( closest_distance > 0 ) {
4872  place_river( closest_point, lake_connection_point );
4873  }
4874  };
4875 
4876  // Get the north and south most points in our ocean.
4877  auto north_south_most = std::minmax_element( ocean_points.begin(), ocean_points.end(),
4878  []( const point_om_omt & lhs, const point_om_omt & rhs ) {
4879  return lhs.y() < rhs.y();
4880  } );
4881 
4882  point_om_omt northmost = *north_south_most.first;
4883  point_om_omt southmost = *north_south_most.second;
4884 
4885  // It's possible that our northmost/southmost points in the lake are not on this overmap, because our
4886  // lake may extend across multiple overmaps.
4887  if( inbounds( northmost ) ) {
4888  connect_lake_to_closest_river( northmost );
4889  }
4890 
4891  if( inbounds( southmost ) ) {
4892  connect_lake_to_closest_river( southmost );
4893  }
4894  }
4895  }
4896 }

Definition at line 5180 of file overmap.cpp.

5182 {
5183  // no railroads if there are no cities
5184  int op_city_size = get_option<int>( "CITY_SIZE" );
5185  if( op_city_size <= 0 ) {
5186  return;
5187  }
5188  const overmap_connection_id &overmap_connection_local_railroad =
5189  settings->overmap_connection.rail_connection;
5190  std::vector<tripoint_om_omt> &railroads_out = connections_out[overmap_connection_local_railroad];
5191 
5192  // At least 3 exit points, to guarantee railroad continuity across overmaps
5193  if( railroads_out.size() < 3 ) {
5194 
5195  std::array<const overmap *, 4> neighbors = { east, south, west, north };
5196  static constexpr std::array<point, 4> neighbor_deltas = {
5197  point_east, point_south, point_west, point_north
5198  };
5199 
5200  // x and y coordinates for a point on the edge in each direction
5201  // -1 represents a variable one dimensional coordinate along that edge
5202  // east == point( OMAPX - 1, n ); north == point( n, 0 );
5203  static constexpr std::array<int, 4> edge_coords_x = {OMAPX - 1, -1, 0, -1};
5204  static constexpr std::array<int, 4> edge_coords_y = {-1, OMAPY - 1, -1, 0};
5205 
5206  // all the points on an edge except the 10 on each end
5207  std::array < int, OMAPX - 20 > omap_num;
5208  for( int i = 0; i < OMAPX - 20; i++ ) {
5209  omap_num[i] = i + 10;
5210  }
5211 
5212  std::array < size_t, 4 > dirs = {0, 1, 2, 3};
5213  std::shuffle( dirs.begin(), dirs.end(), rng_get_engine() );
5214 
5215  for( size_t dir : dirs ) {
5216  // only potentially add a new random connection toward ungenerated overmaps
5217  if( neighbors[dir] == nullptr ) {
5218  std::shuffle( omap_num.begin(), omap_num.end(), rng_get_engine() );
5219  for( const int &i : omap_num ) {
5220  tripoint_om_omt tmp = tripoint_om_omt(
5221  edge_coords_x[dir] >= 0 ? edge_coords_x[dir] : i,
5222  edge_coords_y[dir] >= 0 ? edge_coords_y[dir] : i,
5223  0 );
5224  // Make sure these points don't conflict with rivers.
5225  if( !( is_river( ter( tmp ) ) ||
5226  // avoid adjacent rivers
5227  // east/west of a point on the north/south edge, and vice versa
5228  is_river( ter( tmp + neighbor_deltas[( dir + 1 ) % 4] ) ) ||
5229  is_river( ter( tmp + neighbor_deltas[( dir + 3 ) % 4] ) ) ) ) {
5230  railroads_out.push_back( tmp );
5231  break;
5232  }
5233  }
5234  if( railroads_out.size() == 3 ) {
5235  break;
5236  }
5237  }
5238  }
5239  }
5240 
5241  std::vector<point_om_omt> railroad_points; // cities and railroads_out together
5242  // Compile our master list of railroads; it's less messy if railroads_out is first
5243  railroad_points.reserve( railroads_out.size() + cities.size() );
5244  for( const auto &elem : railroads_out ) {
5245  railroad_points.emplace_back( elem.xy() );
5246  }
5247  for( const city &elem : cities ) {
5248  // place railroads in random point around the center of the city
5249  railroad_points.emplace_back( random_entry(
5250  points_in_radius( tripoint_om_omt( elem.pos, 0 ), elem.size * 4 ) ).xy()
5251  );
5252  }
5253 
5254  // And finally connect them via railroads.
5255  connect_closest_points( railroad_points, 0, *overmap_connection_local_railroad );
5256 }

◆ place_ravines()

void overmap::place_ravines ( )
private

Definition at line 5882 of file overmap.cpp.

5883 {
5884  if( settings->overmap_ravine.num_ravines == 0 ) {
5885  return;
5886  }
5887 
5888  const oter_id rift( "ravine" );
5889  const oter_id rift_edge( "ravine_edge" );
5890  const oter_id rift_floor( "ravine_floor" );
5891  const oter_id rift_floor_edge( "ravine_floor_edge" );
5892 
5893  std::set<point_om_omt> rift_points;
5894 
5895  // We dont really care about the paths each ravine takes, so this can be whatever
5896  // The random return value was chosen because it easily produces decent looking windy ravines
5897  const pf::two_node_scoring_fn<point_om_omt> estimate =
5898  [&]( pf::directed_node<point_om_omt>, const std::optional<pf::directed_node<point_om_omt>> & ) {
5899  return pf::node_score( 0, rng( 1, 2 ) );
5900  };
5901  // A path is generated for each of ravine, and all its constituent points are stored within the
5902  // rift_points set. In the code block below, the set is then used to determine edges and place the
5903  // actual terrain pieces of the ravine.
5904  for( int n = 0; n < settings->overmap_ravine.num_ravines; n++ ) {
5905  const point_rel_omt offset( rng( -settings->overmap_ravine.ravine_range,
5906  settings->overmap_ravine.ravine_range ),
5907  rng( -settings->overmap_ravine.ravine_range, settings->overmap_ravine.ravine_range ) );
5908  const point_om_omt origin( rng( 0, OMAPX ), rng( 0, OMAPY ) );
5909  const point_om_omt destination = origin + offset;
5910  if( !inbounds( destination, settings->overmap_ravine.ravine_width * 3 ) ) {
5911  continue;
5912  }
5913  const auto path = pf::greedy_path( origin, destination, point_om_omt( OMAPX, OMAPY ), estimate );
5914  for( const auto &node : path.nodes ) {
5915  for( int i = 1 - settings->overmap_ravine.ravine_width; i < settings->overmap_ravine.ravine_width;
5916  i++ ) {
5917  for( int j = 1 - settings->overmap_ravine.ravine_width; j < settings->overmap_ravine.ravine_width;
5918  j++ ) {
5919  const point_om_omt n = node.pos + point( j, i );
5920  if( inbounds( n, 1 ) ) {
5921  rift_points.emplace( n );
5922  }
5923  }
5924  }
5925  }
5926  }
5927  // We look at the 8 adjacent locations of each ravine point and see if they are also part of a
5928  // ravine, if at least one of them isn't, the location is part of the ravine's edge. Whatever the
5929  // case, the chosen ravine terrain is then propagated downwards until the ravine_depth specified
5930  // by the region settings.
5931  for( const point_om_omt &p : rift_points ) {
5932  bool edge = false;
5933  for( int ni = -1; ni <= 1 && !edge; ni++ ) {
5934  for( int nj = -1; nj <= 1 && !edge; nj++ ) {
5935  const point_om_omt n = p + point_rel_omt( ni, nj );
5936  if( rift_points.find( n ) == rift_points.end() || !inbounds( n ) ) {
5937  edge = true;
5938  }
5939  }
5940  }
5941  for( int z = 0; z >= settings->overmap_ravine.ravine_depth; z-- ) {
5942  if( z == settings->overmap_ravine.ravine_depth ) {
5943  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( p, z ), edge ? rift_floor_edge : rift_floor );
5944  } else {
5945  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( p, z ), edge ? rift_edge : rift );
5946  }
5947  }
5948  }
5949 
5950 }
point_rel_omt
coords::coord_point< point, coords::origin::relative, coords::omt > point_rel_omt
Definition: coordinates.h:704

regional_settings::overmap_ravine
