◆ place_special_attempt()

bool overmap::place_special_attempt ( overmap_special_batch &  enabled_specials,
const point_om_omt &  sector,
int  sector_width,
bool  place_optional,
bool  must_be_unexplored 
)
private

Attempts to place specials within a sector.

Parameters
enabled_specialsvector of objects that track specials being placed.
sectorsector identifies the location where specials are being placed.
place_optionalrestricts attempting to place specials that have met their minimum count in the first pass.

6694  rng( p2.y(), p2.y() + sector_width - 1 ), 0 );
6695  const city &nearest_city = get_nearest_city( p );
6696 
6697  std::shuffle( enabled_specials.begin(), enabled_specials.end(), rng_get_engine() );
6698  std::set<int> priorities;
6699  for( const overmap_special_placement &os : enabled_specials ) {
6700  priorities.emplace( os.special_details->get_priority() );
6701  }
6702  for( auto pri_iter = priorities.rbegin(); pri_iter != priorities.rend(); ++pri_iter ) {
6703  for( auto iter = enabled_specials.begin(); iter != enabled_specials.end(); ++iter ) {
6704  const overmap_special &special = *iter->special_details;
6705  if( *pri_iter != special.get_priority() ) {
6706  continue;
6707  }
6708  const overmap_special_placement_constraints &constraints = special.get_constraints();
6709  // If we haven't finished placing minimum instances of all specials,
6710  // skip specials that are at their minimum count already.
6711  if( !place_optional && iter->instances_placed >= constraints.occurrences.min ) {
6712  continue;
6713  }
6714  // City check is the fastest => it goes first.
6715  if( !special.can_belong_to_city( p, nearest_city ) ) {
6716  continue;
6717  }
6718  // See if we can actually place the special there.
6719  const om_direction::type rotation = random_special_rotation( special, p, must_be_unexplored );
6720  if( rotation == om_direction::type::invalid ) {
6721  continue;
6722  }
6723 
6724  place_special( special, p, rotation, nearest_city, false, must_be_unexplored );
6725 
6726  if( ++iter->instances_placed >= constraints.occurrences.max ) {
6727  enabled_specials.erase( iter );
6728  }
6729 
6730  return true;
6731  }
6732  }
6733 
6734  return false;
6735 }

◆ place_specials()

void overmap::place_specials ( overmap_special_batch &  enabled_specials)
private

Iterate over the overmap and place the quota of specials.

If the stated minimums are not reached, it will spawn a new nearby overmap and continue placing specials there.

Parameters
enabled_specialsspecifies what specials to place, and tracks how many have been placed.

Definition at line 6768 of file overmap.cpp.

6769 {
6770  // Calculate if this overmap has any lake terrain--if it doesn't, we should just
6771  // completely skip placing any lake specials here since they'll never place and if
6772  // they're mandatory they just end up causing us to spiral out into adjacent overmaps
6773  // which probably don't have lakes either.
6774  bool overmap_has_lake = false;
6775  bool overmap_has_ocean = false;
6776  for( int z = -OVERMAP_DEPTH; z <= OVERMAP_HEIGHT && !overmap_has_lake; z++ ) {
6777  for( int x = 0; x < OMAPX && !overmap_has_lake; x++ ) {
6778  for( int y = 0; y < OMAPY && !overmap_has_lake; y++ ) {
6779  overmap_has_lake = ter_unsafe( { x, y, z } )->is_lake();
6780  }
6781  }
6782  }
6783  for( int z = -OVERMAP_DEPTH; z <= OVERMAP_HEIGHT && !overmap_has_ocean; z++ ) {
6784  for( int x = 0; x < OMAPX && !overmap_has_ocean; x++ ) {
6785  for( int y = 0; y < OMAPY && !overmap_has_ocean; y++ ) {
6786  overmap_has_ocean = ter_unsafe( { x, y, z } )->is_ocean();
6787  }
6788  }
6789  }
6790 
6791  for( auto iter = enabled_specials.begin(); iter != enabled_specials.end(); ) {
6792  // If this special has the LAKE flag and the overmap doesn't have any
6793  // lake terrain, then remove this special from the candidates for this
6794  // overmap.
6795  if( iter->special_details->has_flag( "LAKE" ) && !overmap_has_lake ) {
6796  iter = enabled_specials.erase( iter );
6797  continue;
6798  }
6799  if( iter->special_details->has_flag( "OCEAN" ) && !overmap_has_ocean ) {
6800  iter = enabled_specials.erase( iter );
6801  continue;
6802  }
6803 
6804  const bool unique = iter->special_details->has_flag( "UNIQUE" );
6805  const bool globally_unique = iter->special_details->has_flag( "GLOBALLY_UNIQUE" );
6806  if( unique || globally_unique ) {
6807  const overmap_special_id &id = iter->special_details->id;
6808  const overmap_special_placement_constraints &constraints = iter->special_details->get_constraints();
6809  const float special_count = overmap_buffer.get_unique_special_count( id );
6810  const float overmap_count = overmap_buffer.get_overmap_count();
6811  const float min = special_count > 0 ? constraints.occurrences.min / special_count :
6812  constraints.occurrences.min;
6813  const float max = std::max( overmap_count > 0 ? constraints.occurrences.max / overmap_count :
6814  constraints.occurrences.max, min );
6815  if( x_in_y( min, max ) && ( !globally_unique || !overmap_buffer.contains_unique_special( id ) ) ) {
6816  // Min and max are overloaded to be the chance of occurrence,
6817  // so reset instances placed to one short of max so we don't place several.
6818  iter->instances_placed = constraints.occurrences.max - 1;
6819  } else {
6820  iter = enabled_specials.erase( iter );
6821  continue;
6822  }
6823  }
6824  ++iter;
6825  }
6826  // Bail out early if we have nothing to place.
6827  if( enabled_specials.empty() ) {
6828  return;
6829  }
6830  om_special_sectors sectors = get_sectors( OMSPEC_FREQ );
6831 
6832  // First, place the mandatory specials to ensure that all minimum instance
6833  // counts are met.
6834  place_specials_pass( enabled_specials, sectors, false, false );
6835 
6836  // Snapshot remaining specials, which will be the optional specials and
6837  // any unplaced mandatory specials. By passing a copy into the creation of
6838  // the adjacent overmaps, we ensure that when we unwind the overmap creation
6839  // back to filling in our non-mandatory specials for this overmap, we won't
6840  // count the placement of the specials in those maps when looking for optional
6841  // specials to place here.
6842  overmap_special_batch custom_overmap_specials = enabled_specials;
6843 
6844  // Check for any unplaced mandatory specials, and if there are any, attempt to
6845  // place them on adjacent uncreated overmaps.
6846  bool any_below_minimum =
6847  std::any_of( custom_overmap_specials.begin(), custom_overmap_specials.end(),
6848  []( const overmap_special_placement & placement ) {
6849  return placement.instances_placed <
6850  placement.special_details->get_constraints().occurrences.min;
6851  } );
6852 
6853  if( any_below_minimum ) {
6854  // Randomly select from among the nearest uninitialized overmap positions.
6855  int previous_distance = 0;
6856  std::vector<point_abs_om> nearest_candidates;
6857  // Since this starts at enabled_specials::origin, it will only place new overmaps
6858  // in the 5x5 area surrounding the initial overmap, bounding the amount of work we will do.
6859  for( const point_abs_om &candidate_addr : closest_points_first(
6860  custom_overmap_specials.get_origin(), 2 ) ) {
6861  if( !overmap_buffer.has( candidate_addr ) ) {
6862  int current_distance = square_dist( pos(), candidate_addr );
6863  if( nearest_candidates.empty() || current_distance == previous_distance ) {
6864  nearest_candidates.push_back( candidate_addr );
6865  previous_distance = current_distance;
6866  } else {
6867  break;
6868  }
6869  }
6870  }
6871  if( !nearest_candidates.empty() ) {
6872  point_abs_om new_om_addr = random_entry( nearest_candidates );
6873  overmap_buffer.create_custom_overmap( new_om_addr, custom_overmap_specials );
6874  } else {
6875  std::string msg =
6876  "The following specials could not be placed, some missions may fail to initialize: ";
6877  int n = 0;
6878  for( auto iter = custom_overmap_specials.begin(); iter != custom_overmap_specials.end(); ) {
6879  if( iter->instances_placed < iter->special_details->get_constraints().occurrences.min ) {
6880  msg.append( iter->special_details->id.c_str() ).append( ", " );
6881  n++;
6882  }
6883  ++iter;
6884  }
6885  if( n > 0 ) {
6886  msg = msg.substr( 0, msg.length() - 2 );
6887  } else {
6888  msg = msg.append( "<unknown>" );
6889  }
6890  add_msg( _( msg ) );
6891  }
6892  }
6893  // Then fill in non-mandatory specials.
6894  place_specials_pass( enabled_specials, sectors, true, false );
6895 
6896  // Clean up...
6897  // Because we passed a copy of the specials for placement in adjacent overmaps rather than
6898  // the original, but our caller is concerned with whether or not they were placed at all,
6899  // regardless of whether we placed them or our callee did, we need to reconcile the placement
6900  // that we did of the optional specials with the placement our callee did of optional
6901  // and mandatory.
6902 
6903  // Make a lookup of our callee's specials after processing.
6904  // Because specials are removed from the list once they meet their maximum
6905  // occurrences, this will only contain those which have not yet met their
6906  // maximum.
6907  std::map<overmap_special_id, int> processed_specials;
6908  for( overmap_special_placement &elem : custom_overmap_specials ) {
6909  processed_specials[elem.special_details->id] = elem.instances_placed;
6910  }
6911 
6912  // Loop through the specials we started with.
6913  for( auto it = enabled_specials.begin(); it != enabled_specials.end(); ) {
6914  // Determine if this special is still in our callee's list of specials...
6915  std::map<overmap_special_id, int>::iterator iter = processed_specials.find(
6916  it->special_details->id );
6917  if( iter != processed_specials.end() ) {
6918  // ... and if so, increment the placement count to reflect the callee's.
6919  it->instances_placed += ( iter->second - it->instances_placed );
6920 
6921  // If, after incrementing the placement count, we're at our max, remove
6922  // this special from our list.
6923  if( it->instances_placed >= it->special_details->get_constraints().occurrences.max ) {
6924  it = enabled_specials.erase( it );
6925  } else {
6926  it++;
6927  }
6928  } else {
6929  // This special is no longer in our callee's list, which means it was completely
6930  // placed, and we can remove it from our list.
6931  it = enabled_specials.erase( it );
6932  }
6933  }
6934 }

void overmap::place_specials_pass ( overmap_special_batch &  enabled_specials,
om_special_sectors &  sectors,
bool  place_optional,
bool  must_be_unexplored 
)
private

Walk over the overmap and attempt to place specials.

Parameters
enabled_specialsvector of objects that track specials being placed.
sectorssectors in which to attempt placement.
place_optionalrestricts attempting to place specials that have met their minimum count in the first pass.

Definition at line 6737 of file overmap.cpp.

6740 {
6741  // Walk over sectors in random order, to minimize "clumping".
6742  std::shuffle( sectors.sectors.begin(), sectors.sectors.end(), rng_get_engine() );
6743  for( auto it = sectors.sectors.begin(); it != sectors.sectors.end(); ) {
6744  const size_t attempts = 10;
6745  bool placed = false;
6746  for( size_t i = 0; i < attempts; ++i ) {
6747  if( place_special_attempt( enabled_specials, *it, sectors.sector_width, place_optional,
6748  must_be_unexplored ) ) {
6749  placed = true;
6750  it = sectors.sectors.erase( it );
6751  if( enabled_specials.empty() ) {
6752  return; // Job done. Bail out.
6753  }
6754  break;
6755  }
6756  }
6757 
6758  if( !placed ) {
6759  it++;
6760  }
6761  }
6762 }

void overmap::place_swamps ( )
private

Definition at line 5051 of file overmap.cpp.

5052 {
5053  // Buffer our river terrains by a variable radius and increment a counter for the location each
5054  // time it's included in a buffer. It's a floodplain that we'll then intersect later with some
5055  // noise to adjust how frequently it occurs.
5056  std::unique_ptr<cata::mdarray<int, point_om_omt>> floodptr =
5057  std::make_unique<cata::mdarray<int, point_om_omt>>( 0 );
5058  cata::mdarray<int, point_om_omt> &floodplain = *floodptr;
5059  for( int x = 0; x < OMAPX; x++ ) {
5060  for( int y = 0; y < OMAPY; y++ ) {
5061  const tripoint_om_omt pos( x, y, 0 );
5062  if( is_ot_match( "river", ter_unsafe( pos ), ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
5063  std::vector<point_om_omt> buffered_points =
5064  closest_points_first(
5065  pos.xy(),
5066  rng( settings->overmap_forest.river_floodplain_buffer_distance_min,
5067  settings->overmap_forest.river_floodplain_buffer_distance_max ) );
5068  for( const point_om_omt &p : buffered_points ) {
5069  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
5070  continue;
5071  }
5072  floodplain[p] += 1;
5073  }
5074  }
5075  }
5076  }
5077 
5078  // Get a layer of noise to use in conjunction with our river buffered floodplain.
5079  const om_noise::om_noise_layer_floodplain f( global_base_point(), g->get_seed() );
5080 
5081  for( int x = 0; x < OMAPX; x++ ) {
5082  for( int y = 0; y < OMAPY; y++ ) {
5083  const tripoint_om_omt pos( x, y, 0 );
5084  // If this location isn't a forest, there's nothing to do here. We'll only grow swamps in existing
5085  // forest terrain.
5086  if( !is_ot_match( "forest", ter( pos ), ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
5087  continue;
5088  }
5089 
5090  // If this was a part of our buffered floodplain, and the noise here meets the threshold, and the one_in rng
5091  // triggers, then we should flood this location and make it a swamp.
5092  const bool should_flood = ( floodplain[x][y] > 0 && !one_in( floodplain[x][y] ) && f.noise_at( { x, y } )
5093  > settings->overmap_forest.noise_threshold_swamp_adjacent_water );
5094 
5095  // If this location meets our isolated swamp threshold, regardless of floodplain values, we'll make it
5096  // into a swamp.
5097  const bool should_isolated_swamp = f.noise_at( pos.xy() ) >
5098  settings->overmap_forest.noise_threshold_swamp_isolated;
5099  if( should_flood || should_isolated_swamp ) {
5100  ter_set( pos, oter_forest_water );
5101  }
5102  }
5103  }
5104 }

2873  overmap_special_batch enabled_specials = overmap_specials::get_default_batch( loc );
2874  const overmap_feature_flag_settings &overmap_feature_flag = settings->overmap_feature_flag;
2875 
2876  const bool should_blacklist = !overmap_feature_flag.blacklist.empty();
2877  const bool should_whitelist = !overmap_feature_flag.whitelist.empty();
2878 
2879  // If this region's settings has blacklisted or whitelisted overmap feature flags, let's
2880  // filter our default batch.
2881 
2882  // Remove any items that have a flag that is present in the blacklist.
2883  if( should_blacklist ) {
2884  for( auto it = enabled_specials.begin(); it != enabled_specials.end(); ) {
2885  if( cata::sets_intersect( overmap_feature_flag.blacklist,
2886  it->special_details->get_flags() ) ) {

2898  it->special_details->get_flags() ) ) {

◆ random_special_rotation()

om_direction::type overmap::random_special_rotation ( const overmap_special &  special,

Definition at line 6536 of file overmap.cpp.

6538 {
6539  std::vector<om_direction::type> rotations( om_direction::size );
6540  const auto first = rotations.begin();
6541  auto last = first;
6542 
6543  int top_score = 0; // Maximal number of existing connections (roads).
6544  // Try to find the most suitable rotation: satisfy as many connections
6545  // as possible with the existing terrain.
6546  for( om_direction::type r : om_direction::all ) {
6547  int score = special.score_rotation_at( *this, p, r );
6548 
6549  if( score >= top_score ) {
6550  if( score > top_score ) {
6551  top_score = score;
6552  last = first; // New top score. Forget previous rotations.
6553  }
6554  *last = r;
6555  ++last;
6556  }
6557 
6558  if( !special.is_rotatable() ) {
6559  break;
6560  }
6561  }
6562  // Pick first valid rotation at random.
6563  std::shuffle( first, last, rng_get_engine() );
6564  const auto rotation = std::find_if( first, last, [&]( om_direction::type elem ) {
6565  return can_place_special( special, p, elem, must_be_unexplored );
6566  } );
6567 
6568  return rotation != last ? *rotation : om_direction::type::invalid;
6569 }

4276 {
4277  tripoint_om_sm p( p_rel.raw() );
4278  tripoint_abs_sm absp = project_combine( pos(), p );
4279  for( auto &elem : zg ) {
4280  mongroup &mg = elem.second;
4281  if( !mg.horde ) {
4282  continue;
4283  }
4284  const int dist = rl_dist( absp, mg.abs_pos );
4285  if( sig_power < dist ) {
4286  continue;
4287  }
4288  if( mg.behaviour == mongroup::horde_behaviour::nemesis ) {
4289  // nemesis hordes are signaled to the player by their own function and dont react to noise
4290  continue;
4291  }
4292  // TODO: base this in monster attributes, foremost GOODHEARING.
4293  const int inter_per_sig_power = 15; //Interest per signal value
4294  const int min_initial_inter = 30; //Min initial interest for horde
4295  const int calculated_inter = ( sig_power + 1 - dist ) * inter_per_sig_power; // Calculated interest
4296  const int roll = rng( 0, mg.interest );
4297  // Minimum capped calculated interest. Used to give horde enough interest to really investigate the target at start.
4298  const int min_capped_inter = std::max( min_initial_inter, calculated_inter );
4299  if( roll < min_capped_inter ) { //Rolling if horde interested in new signal
4300  // TODO: Z-coordinate for mongroup targets
4301  const int targ_dist = rl_dist( absp.xy(), mg.target );
4302  // TODO: Base this on targ_dist:dist ratio.
4303  if( targ_dist < 5 ) { // If signal source already pursued by horde
4304  mg.set_target( midpoint( mg.target, absp.xy() ) );
4305  const int min_inc_inter = 3; // Min interest increase to already targeted source
4306  const int inc_roll = rng( min_inc_inter, calculated_inter );
4307  mg.inc_interest( inc_roll );
4308  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_OVERMAP, "horde inc interest %d dist %d", inc_roll, dist );
4309  } else { // New signal source
4310  mg.set_target( absp.xy() );
4311  mg.set_interest( min_capped_inter );
4312  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_OVERMAP, "horde set interest %d dist %d", min_capped_inter, dist );
4313  }
4314  }
4315  }
4316 }

◆ ter_set()

void overmap::ter_set ( const tripoint_om_omt &  p,
const oter_id &  id 
)

TODO: Add a debug message reporting this, but currently there are way too many place that would trigger it.

Definition at line 2925 of file overmap.cpp.

2926 {
2927  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
2928  /// TODO: Add a debug message reporting this, but currently there are way too many place that would trigger it.
2929  return;
2930  }
2931 
2932  oter_id &current_oter = layer[p.z() + OVERMAP_DEPTH].terrain[p.xy()];
2933  const oter_type_str_id &current_type_id = current_oter->get_type_id();
2934  const oter_type_str_id &incoming_type_id = id->get_type_id();
2935  const bool current_type_same = current_type_id == incoming_type_id;
2936 
2937  // Mapgen refinement can push multiple different roads over each other.
2938  // Roads require a predecessor. A road pushed over a road might cause a
2939  // road to be a predecessor to another road. That causes too many spawns
2940  // to happen. So when pushing a predecessor, if the predecessor to-be-pushed
2941  // is linear and the previous predecessor is linear, overwrite it.
2942  // This way only the 'last' rotation/variation generated is kept.
2943  if( id->has_flag( oter_flags::requires_predecessor ) ) {
2944  std::vector<oter_id> &om_predecessors = predecessors_[p];
2945  if( om_predecessors.empty() || ( !current_oter->is_linear() && !current_type_same ) ) {
2946  // If we need a predecessor, we must have a predecessor no matter what.
2947  // Or, if the oter to-be-pushed is not linear, push it only if the incoming oter is different.
2948  om_predecessors.push_back( current_oter );
2949  } else if( !current_type_same ) {
2950  // Current oter is linear, incoming oter is different from current.
2951  // If the last predecessor is the same type as the current type, overwrite.
2952  // Else push the current type.
2953  oter_id &last_predecessor = om_predecessors.back();
2954  if( last_predecessor->get_type_id() == current_type_id ) {
2955  last_predecessor = current_oter;
2956  } else {
2957  om_predecessors.push_back( current_oter );
2958  }
2959  }
2960  // We had a predecessor, and it was the same type as the incoming one
2961  // Don't push another copy.
2962  }
2963  current_oter = id;
2964 }
oter_flags::requires_predecessor
@ requires_predecessor

References oter_t::get_type_id(), base_camps::id, inbounds(), oter_t::is_linear(), layer, OVERMAP_DEPTH, predecessors_, requires_predecessor, coords::coord_point< Point, Origin, Scale, InBounds >::xy(), and coords::coord_point_mut< Point, Subpoint, InBounds >::z().

Referenced by build_city_street(), build_connection(), build_lab(), build_slimepit(), chip_rock(), generate_bridgeheads(), generate_over(), generate_sub(), good_river(), migrate_oter_ids(), place_cities(), place_forests(), place_lakes(), place_oceans(), place_ravines(), place_river(), place_rivers(), place_swamps(), overmapbuffer::ter_set(), and unserialize_omap().

void overmap::unserialize ( const JsonObject &  jsobj)

404 {
405  // These must be read in this order.
406  if( jsobj.has_member( "mapgen_arg_storage" ) ) {
407  jsobj.read( "mapgen_arg_storage", mapgen_arg_storage, true );
408  }
409  if( jsobj.has_member( "mapgen_arg_index" ) ) {
410  std::vector<std::pair<tripoint_om_omt, int>> flat_index;
411  jsobj.read( "mapgen_arg_index", flat_index, true );
412  for( const std::pair<tripoint_om_omt, int> &p : flat_index ) {
413  auto it = mapgen_arg_storage.get_iterator_from_index( p.second );
414  mapgen_args_index.emplace( p.first, &*it );
415  }
416  }
417  // Extract layers first so predecessor deduplication can happen.
418  if( jsobj.has_member( "layers" ) ) {
419  std::unordered_map<tripoint_om_omt, std::string> oter_id_migrations;
420  JsonArray layers_json = jsobj.get_array( "layers" );
421

423  JsonArray layer_json = layers_json.next_array();
424  int count = 0;

426  oter_id tmp_otid( 0 );
427  for( int j = 0; j < OMAPY; j++ ) {
428  for( int i = 0; i < OMAPX; i++ ) {
429  if( count == 0 ) {
430  {
431  JsonArray rle_terrain = layer_json.next_array();
432  tmp_ter = rle_terrain.next_string();
433  count = rle_terrain.next_int();
434  if( rle_terrain.has_more() ) {
435  rle_terrain.throw_error( 2, "Unexpected value in RLE encoding" );
436  }
437  }
438  if( is_oter_id_obsolete( tmp_ter ) ) {
439  for( int p = i; p < i + count; p++ ) {
440  oter_id_migrations.emplace( tripoint_om_omt( p, j, z - OVERMAP_DEPTH ), tmp_ter );
441  }
442  } else if( oter_str_id( tmp_ter ).is_valid() ) {
443  tmp_otid = oter_id( tmp_ter );
444  } else {
445  debugmsg( "Loaded invalid oter_id '%s'", tmp_ter.c_str() );
446  tmp_otid = oter_omt_obsolete;
447  }
448  }
449  count--;
450  layer[z].terrain[i][j] = tmp_otid;
451  }
452  }
453  }
454  migrate_oter_ids( oter_id_migrations );

464  // TODO: optimize

466  }
467  }

480  } else if( city_member_name == "id" ) {

554  monster new_monster;

617  overmap_special_id s;

620  special_placement_json.read( "special", s );
621  s = overmap_special_migration::migrate( s );
622  if( !s.is_null() ) {
623  is_safe_zone = s->has_flag( "SAFE_AT_WORLDGEN" );
624  }

630  for( JsonObject placement_json : placements_json ) {
631  for( JsonMember placement_member : placement_json ) {
632  std::string name = placement_member.name();
633  if( name == "points" ) {
634  JsonArray points_json = placement_member;
635  for( JsonObject point_json : points_json ) {
636  tripoint_om_omt p;
637  for( JsonMember point_member : point_json ) {
638  std::string name = point_member.name();
639  if( name == "p" ) {
640  point_member.read( p );
641  if( !s.is_null() ) {
642  overmap_special_placements[p] = s;
643  if( is_safe_zone ) {
644  safe_at_worldgen.emplace( p );
645  }
646  }
647  }
648  }
649  }
650  }
651  }
652  }
653  }
654  }
655  }
656  } else if( name == "joins_used" ) {
657  std::vector<std::pair<om_pos_dir, std::string>> flat_index;
658  om_member.read( flat_index, true );
659  for( const std::pair<om_pos_dir, std::string> &p : flat_index ) {
660  joins_used.insert( p );
661  }
662  } else if( name == "predecessors" ) {
663  std::vector<std::pair<tripoint_om_omt, std::vector<oter_id>>> flattened_predecessors;
664  JsonArray predecessors_json = om_member;
665  for( JsonArray point_and_predecessors : predecessors_json ) {
666  if( point_and_predecessors.size() != 2 ) {
667  point_and_predecessors.throw_error( 2,
668  "Invalid overmap predecessors: expected a point and an array" );
669  }
670  tripoint_om_omt point;
671  point_and_predecessors.read( 0, point, true );
672  std::vector<oter_id> predecessors;
673  for( std::string oterid : point_and_predecessors.get_array( 1 ) ) {
674  predecessors.push_back( get_or_migrate_oter( oterid ) );
675  }
676  flattened_predecessors.emplace_back( point, std::move( predecessors ) );
677  }
678 
679  std::vector<oter_id> om_predecessors;
680 
681  for( auto& [p, serialized_predecessors] : flattened_predecessors ) {
682  if( !serialized_predecessors.empty() ) {
683  // TODO remove after 0.H release.
684  // JSONizing roads caused some bad mapgen data to get saved to disk. Fixup bad saves to conform.
685  // The logic to do this is to emulate setting overmap::set_ter repeatedly. The difference is the
686  // 'original' terrain is lost, all we have is a chain of predecessors.
687  // This doesn't matter for the sake of deduplicating predecessors.
688  //
689  // Mapgen refinement can push multiple different roads over each other.
690  // Roads require a predecessor. A road pushed over a road might cause a
691  // road to be a predecessor to another road. That causes too many spawns
692  // to happen. So when pushing a predecessor, if the predecessor to-be-pushed
693  // is linear and the previous predecessor is linear, overwrite it.
694  // This way only the 'last' rotation/variation generated is kept.
695  om_predecessors.reserve( serialized_predecessors.size() );
696  oter_id current_oter;
697  auto local_set_ter = [&]( oter_id & id ) {
698  const oter_type_str_id &current_type_id = current_oter->get_type_id();
699  const oter_type_str_id &incoming_type_id = id->get_type_id();
700  const bool current_type_same = current_type_id == incoming_type_id;
701  if( om_predecessors.empty() || ( !current_oter->is_linear() && !current_type_same ) ) {
702  // If we need a predecessor, we must have a predecessor no matter what.
703  // Or, if the oter to-be-pushed is not linear, push it only if the incoming oter is different.
704  om_predecessors.push_back( current_oter );
705  } else if( !current_type_same ) {
706  // Current oter is linear, incoming oter is different from current.
707  // If the last predecessor is the same type as the current type, overwrite.
708  // Else push the current type.
709  oter_id &last_predecessor = om_predecessors.back();
710  if( last_predecessor->get_type_id() == current_type_id ) {
711  last_predecessor = current_oter;
712  } else {
713  om_predecessors.push_back( current_oter );
714  }
715  }
716  current_oter = id;
717  };
718 
719  current_oter = serialized_predecessors.front();
720  for( size_t i = 1; i < serialized_predecessors.size(); ++i ) {
721  local_set_ter( serialized_predecessors[i] );
722  }
723  local_set_ter( layer[p.z() + OVERMAP_DEPTH].terrain[p.xy()] );
724  }
725  predecessors_.insert_or_assign( p, std::move( om_predecessors ) );
726 
727  // Reuse allocations because it's a good habit.
728  om_predecessors = std::move( serialized_predecessors );
729  om_predecessors.clear();
730  }
731  }
732  }
733 }
JsonArray::next_string
std::string next_string()
Definition: flexbuffer_json-inl.h:692

void overmap::unserialize_omap ( const JsonValue &  jsin,

737 {
738  JsonArray ja = jsin.get_array();
739  JsonObject jo = ja.next_object();
740 
741  std::string type;
742  point_abs_om om_pos( point_min );
743  int z = 0;
744 
745  jo.read( "type", type );
746  jo.read( "om_pos", om_pos );
747  jo.read( "z", z );
748  JsonArray jal = jo.get_array( "layers" );
749 
750  std::vector<tripoint_om_omt> lake_points;
751  std::vector<tripoint_om_omt> ocean_points;
752  std::vector<tripoint_om_omt> forest_points;
753 
754  if( type == "overmap" ) {
755  std::unordered_map<tripoint_om_omt, std::string> oter_id_migrations;
756  if( om_pos != pos() ) {
757  debugmsg( "Loaded invalid overmap from omap file %s. Loaded %s, expected %s",
758  json_path.generic_u8string(), om_pos.to_string(), pos().to_string() );
759  } else {
760  int count = 0;
761  std::string tmp_ter;
762  oter_id tmp_otid( 0 );
763  for( int j = 0; j < OMAPY; j++ ) {
764  for( int i = 0; i < OMAPX; i++ ) {
765  if( count == 0 ) {
766  JsonArray jat = jal.next_array();
767  tmp_ter = jat.next_string();
768  count = jat.next_int();
769  if( is_oter_id_obsolete( tmp_ter ) ) {
770  for( int p = i; p < i + count; p++ ) {
771  oter_id_migrations.emplace( tripoint_om_omt( p, j, z - OVERMAP_DEPTH ), tmp_ter );
772  }
773  } else if( oter_str_id( tmp_ter ).is_valid() ) {
774  tmp_otid = oter_id( tmp_ter );
775  } else {
776  debugmsg( "Loaded invalid oter_id '%s'", tmp_ter.c_str() );
777  tmp_otid = oter_omt_obsolete;
778  }
779  }
780  count--;
781  layer[z + OVERMAP_DEPTH].terrain[i][j] = tmp_otid;
782  if( tmp_otid == oter_lake_shore || tmp_otid == oter_lake_surface ) {
783  lake_points.emplace_back( i, j, z );
784  }
785  if( tmp_otid == oter_ocean_shore || tmp_otid == oter_ocean_surface ) {
786  ocean_points.emplace_back( i, j, z );
787  }
788  if( tmp_otid == oter_forest || tmp_otid == oter_forest_thick ) {
789  forest_points.emplace_back( i, j, z );
790  }
791  }
792  }
793  }
794  migrate_oter_ids( oter_id_migrations );
795  }
796 
797  std::unordered_set<tripoint_om_omt> lake_set;
798  for( auto &p : lake_points ) {
799  lake_set.emplace( p );
800  }
801 
802  for( auto &p : lake_points ) {
803  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
804  continue;
805  }
806 
807  bool shore = false;
808  for( int ni = -1; ni <= 1 && !shore; ni++ ) {
809  for( int nj = -1; nj <= 1 && !shore; nj++ ) {
810  const tripoint_om_omt n = p + point( ni, nj );
811  if( inbounds( n, 1 ) && lake_set.find( n ) == lake_set.end() ) {
812  shore = true;
813  }
814  }
815  }
816 
817  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( p ), shore ? oter_lake_shore : oter_lake_surface );
818 
819  // If this is not a shore, we'll make our subsurface lake cubes and beds.
820  if( !shore ) {
821  for( int z = -1; z > settings->overmap_lake.lake_depth; z-- ) {
822  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( p.xy(), z ), oter_lake_water_cube );
823  }
824  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( p.xy(), settings->overmap_lake.lake_depth ), oter_lake_bed );
825  layer[p.z() + OVERMAP_DEPTH].terrain[p.x()][p.y()] = oter_lake_surface;
826  }
827  }
828  std::unordered_set<tripoint_om_omt> ocean_set;
829  for( auto &p : ocean_points ) {
830  ocean_set.emplace( p );
831  }
832  for( auto &p : ocean_points ) {
833  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
834  continue;
835  }
836 
837  bool shore = false;
838  for( int ni = -1; ni <= 1 && !shore; ni++ ) {
839  for( int nj = -1; nj <= 1 && !shore; nj++ ) {
840  const tripoint_om_omt n = p + point( ni, nj );
841  if( inbounds( n, 1 ) && ocean_set.find( n ) == ocean_set.end() ) {
842  shore = true;
843  }
844  }
845  }
846 
847  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( p ), shore ? oter_ocean_shore : oter_ocean_surface );
848 
849  // If this is not a shore, we'll make our subsurface ocean cubes and beds.
850  if( !shore ) {
851  for( int z = -1; z > settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_depth; z-- ) {
852  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( p.xy(), z ), oter_ocean_water_cube );
853  }
854  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( p.xy(), settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_depth ), oter_ocean_bed );
855  layer[p.z() + OVERMAP_DEPTH].terrain[p.x()][p.y()] = oter_ocean_surface;
856  }
857  }
858  std::unordered_set<tripoint_om_omt> forest_set;
859  for( auto &p : forest_points ) {
860  forest_set.emplace( p );
861  }
862 
863  for( auto &p : forest_points ) {
864  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
865  continue;
866  }
867  bool forest_border = false;
868  for( int ni = -1; ni <= 1 && !forest_border; ni++ ) {
869  for( int nj = -1; nj <= 1 && !forest_border; nj++ ) {
870  const tripoint_om_omt n = p + point( ni, nj );
871  if( inbounds( n, 1 ) && forest_set.find( n ) == forest_set.end() ) {
872  forest_border = true;
873  }
874  }
875  }
876 
877  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( p ), forest_border ? oter_forest : oter_forest_thick );
878  }
879 }

◆ monster_map

std::unordered_multimap<tripoint_om_sm, monster> overmap::monster_map

When monsters despawn during map-shifting they will be added here.

map::spawn_monsters will load them and place them into the reality bubble (adding it to the creature tracker and putting it onto the map). This stores each submap worth of monsters in a different bucket of the multimap.

Definition at line 392 of file overmap.h.

Referenced by monster_check(), move_hordes(), serialize(), and unserialize().
